import React,{ useState, MouseEvent } from "react" import { Box, Button, ButtonGroup, Card, CardContent, CardHeader, Container, Divider } from "@mui/material" import { Calendar, type Event, dateFnsLocalizer } from "react-big-calendar" import format from "date-fns/format" import parse from "date-fns/parse" import startOfWeek from "date-fns/startOfWeek" import getDay from "date-fns/getDay" import enUS from "date-fns/locale/en-US" import "react-big-calendar/lib/css/react-big-calendar.css" import EventInfo from "./EventInfo" import AddEventModal from "./AddEventModal" import EventInfoModal from "./EventInfoModal" import { AddTodoModal } from "./AddTodoModal" import AddDatePickerEventModal from "./AddDatePickerEventModal" const locales = { "en-US": enUS, } const localizer = dateFnsLocalizer({ format, parse, startOfWeek, getDay, locales, }) export interface ITodo { _id: string title: string color?: string } export interface IEventInfo extends Event { _id: string description: string todoId?: string } export interface EventFormData { description: string todoId?: string } export interface DatePickerEventFormData { description: string todoId?: string allDay: boolean start?: Date end?: Date } export const generateId = () => (Math.floor(Math.random() * 10000) + 1).toString() const initialEventFormState: EventFormData = { description: "", todoId: undefined, } const initialDatePickerEventFormData: DatePickerEventFormData = { description: "", todoId: undefined, allDay: false, start: undefined, end: undefined, } const EventCalendar = () => { const [openSlot, setOpenSlot] = useState(false) const [openDatepickerModal, setOpenDatepickerModal] = useState(false) const [openTodoModal, setOpenTodoModal] = useState(false) const [currentEvent, setCurrentEvent] = useState<Event | IEventInfo | null>(null) const [eventInfoModal, setEventInfoModal] = useState(false) const [events, setEvents] = useState<IEventInfo[]>([]) const [todos, setTodos] = useState<ITodo[]>([]) const [eventFormData, setEventFormData] = useState<EventFormData>(initialEventFormState) const [datePickerEventFormData, setDatePickerEventFormData] = useState<DatePickerEventFormData>(initialDatePickerEventFormData) const handleSelectSlot = (event: Event) => { setOpenSlot(true) setCurrentEvent(event) } const handleSelectEvent = (event: IEventInfo) => { setCurrentEvent(event) setEventInfoModal(true) } const handleClose = () => { setEventFormData(initialEventFormState) setOpenSlot(false) } const handleDatePickerClose = () => { setDatePickerEventFormData(initialDatePickerEventFormData) setOpenDatepickerModal(false) } const onAddEvent = (e: MouseEvent<HTMLButtonElement>) => { e.preventDefault() const data: IEventInfo = { ...eventFormData, _id: generateId(), start: currentEvent?.start, end: currentEvent?.end, } const newEvents = [...events, data] setEvents(newEvents) handleClose() } const onAddEventFromDatePicker = (e: MouseEvent<HTMLButtonElement>) => { e.preventDefault() const addHours = (date: Date | undefined, hours: number) => { return date ? date.setHours(date.getHours() + hours) : undefined } const setMinToZero = (date: any) => { date.setSeconds(0) return date } const data: IEventInfo = { ...datePickerEventFormData, _id: generateId(), start: setMinToZero(datePickerEventFormData.start), end: datePickerEventFormData.allDay ? addHours(datePickerEventFormData.start, 12) : setMinToZero(datePickerEventFormData.end), } const newEvents = [...events, data] setEvents(newEvents) setDatePickerEventFormData(initialDatePickerEventFormData) } const onDeleteEvent = () => { setEvents(() => [...events].filter((e) => e._id !== (currentEvent as IEventInfo)._id!)) setEventInfoModal(false) } return ( <Box mt={2} mb={2} component="main" sx={{ flexGrow: 1, py: 8, }} > <Container maxWidth={false}> <Card> <CardHeader title="Calendar" subheader="Create Events and Todos and manage them easily" /> <Divider /> <CardContent> <Box sx={{ display: "flex", justifyContent: "space-between" }}> <ButtonGroup size="large" variant="contained" aria-label="outlined primary button group"> <Button onClick={() => setOpenDatepickerModal(true)} size="small" variant="contained"> Add event </Button> <Button onClick={() => setOpenTodoModal(true)} size="small" variant="contained"> Create todo </Button> </ButtonGroup> </Box> <Divider style={{ margin: 10 }} /> <AddEventModal open={openSlot} handleClose={handleClose} eventFormData={eventFormData} setEventFormData={setEventFormData} onAddEvent={onAddEvent} todos={todos} /> <AddDatePickerEventModal open={openDatepickerModal} handleClose={handleDatePickerClose} datePickerEventFormData={datePickerEventFormData} setDatePickerEventFormData={setDatePickerEventFormData} onAddEvent={onAddEventFromDatePicker} todos={todos} /> <EventInfoModal open={eventInfoModal} handleClose={() => setEventInfoModal(false)} onDeleteEvent={onDeleteEvent} currentEvent={currentEvent as IEventInfo} /> <AddTodoModal open={openTodoModal} handleClose={() => setOpenTodoModal(false)} todos={todos} setTodos={setTodos} /> <Calendar localizer={localizer} events={events} onSelectEvent={handleSelectEvent} onSelectSlot={handleSelectSlot} selectable startAccessor="start" components={{ event: EventInfo }} endAccessor="end" defaultView="week" eventPropGetter={(event) => { const hasTodo = todos.find((todo) => todo._id === event.todoId) return { style: { backgroundColor: hasTodo ? hasTodo.color : "#b64fc8", borderColor: hasTodo ? hasTodo.color : "#b64fc8", }, } }} style={{ height: 900, }} /> </CardContent> </Card> </Container> </Box> ) } export default EventCalendar
ChatGPT

The code you provided defines a React component called EventCalendar that utilizes the react-big-calendar library to create a calendar with event management features. Here's a breakdown of what the component does:

  1. Imports: The component imports various modules and components from external libraries such as react, date-fns, react-big-calendar, and custom modal components.

  2. State: The component uses React hooks like useState to manage its state. It maintains state for controlling modal visibility (openSlot, openDatepickerModal, openTodoModal, eventInfoModal), current event (currentEvent), event data (events), todo data (todos), and form data for adding events and todos (eventFormData and datePickerEventFormData).

  3. Event Handlers: The component defines event handler functions for selecting slots and events, closing modals, adding events from different sources, and deleting events.

  4. Render Method: The EventCalendar component renders a container Box component that wraps the calendar and modals. Inside the container, it renders a Card component with a header, buttons for adding events and todos, and a divider. It also renders various modal components (AddEventModal, AddDatePickerEventModal, EventInfoModal, AddTodoModal) for adding events and todos. The main content of the calendar is rendered using the Calendar component from react-big-calendar, configured with various props to customize its behavior and appearance.

  5. Export: Finally, the EventCalendar component is exported as the default export of the module.

This component seems to provide comprehensive functionality for managing events and todos within a calendar interface. If you encounter any specific issues or have further questions about this code, feel free to ask!

import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { ScheduleComponent, ViewsDirective, ViewDirective, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import { DropDownList } from '@syncfusion/ej2-dropdowns'; import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA=='); const CalendarM = () => { const [events, setEvents] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { // Fetch events from the backend when the component mounts fetchEvents(); }, []); const fetchEvents = () => { fetch('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar') .then(response => response.json()) .then(data => setEvents(data)) .catch(error => console.error('Error fetching events:', error)); } const onPopupOpen = (args) => { if (args.type === 'Editor') { if (!args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-row')) { let row = document.createElement('div'); row.className = 'custom-field-row'; let formElement = args.element.querySelector('.e-schedule-form'); formElement.firstChild.insertBefore(row, formElement.firstChild.firstChild); let container = document.createElement('div'); container.className = 'custom-field-container'; let inputEle = document.createElement('input'); inputEle.className = 'e-field'; inputEle.setAttribute('name', 'EventType'); container.appendChild(inputEle); row.appendChild(container); let drowDownList = new DropDownList({ dataSource: [ { text: 'Public Event', value: 'public-event' }, { text: 'Maintenance', value: 'maintenance' }, { text: 'Commercial Event', value: 'commercial-event' }, { text: 'Family Event', value: 'family-event' } ], fields: { text: 'text', value: 'value' }, floatLabelType: 'Always', placeholder: 'Event Type' }); drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle); } } } const [credentials, setCredentials] = useState({ title:"",startDate:"",endDate:"",description:""}); const handleEventCreated = async (e) => { e.prevantDefault(); // const { title, startTime, endTime, description } = args.data; // Send a POST request to save the event in the database const response = await fetch('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', }, body: JSON.stringify({ title:credentials.title, startDate: credentials.startDate, endDate: credentials.endDate, description:credentials.description }); const json = await response.json() console.log(json); }) .then(response => response.json()) .then(data => { console.log('Event saved:', data); // Update the events state with the newly created event setEvents(prevEvents => [...prevEvents, data]); }) .catch(error => console.error('Error saving event:', error)); } const onChange = (e) => { setCredentials({ ...credentials, [e.target.name]: e.target.value }); } return ( <div> {events.length > 0 && ( <ScheduleComponent width='100%' height='550px' selectedDate={new Date(2018, 1, 15)} eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} // Pass events as dataSource popupOpen={onPopupOpen} eventCreated={handleEventCreated} > <ViewsDirective> <ViewDirective option='Day' /> <ViewDirective option='Week' /> <ViewDirective option='WorkWeek' /> <ViewDirective option='Month' /> </ViewsDirective> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month]} /> </ScheduleComponent> )} </div> ); } export default CalendarM;
ChatGPT

Your handleEventCreated function contains a couple of syntax errors and a logical issue. Here's the corrected version:

javascript
const handleEventCreated = async () => {
    try {
        // Send a POST request to save the event in the database
        const response = await fetch('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', {
            method: 'POST',
            headers: {
                'Content-Type': 'application/json',
            },
            body: JSON.stringify(credentials),
        });
        const data = await response.json();
        console.log('Event saved:', data);
        // Update the events state with the newly created event
        setEvents(prevEvents => [...prevEvents, data]);
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error saving event:', error);
    }
};

Changes made:

  1. Removed e parameter from handleEventCreated since it's not being used.
  2. Removed preventDefault() call as it's not necessary.
  3. Removed unnecessary then chaining after fetch call and replaced with try-catch block for error handling.
  4. Passed credentials directly as the body of the POST request in JSON.stringify(credentials).

With these changes, your handleEventCreated function should work correctly to save the event to the database and update the events state.

import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { Calendar, momentLocalizer } from 'react-big-calendar'; import 'react-big-calendar/lib/css/react-big-calendar.css'; import moment from 'moment'; import Modal from 'react-modal'; const localizer = momentLocalizer(moment); const CalendarM = () => { const [events, setEvents] = useState([]); const [modalIsOpen, setModalIsOpen] = useState(false); const [newEvent, setNewEvent] = useState({ title: '', start: '', end: '', description: '' }); useEffect(() => { fetchEvents(); }, []); const fetchEvents = async () => { try { const response = await fetch('/api/auth/calendar'); const data = await response.json(); setEvents(data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching events:', error); } }; const handleDateSelect = (slotInfo) => { setNewEvent({ ...newEvent, start: slotInfo.start, end: slotInfo.end }); setModalIsOpen(true); }; const closeModal = () => { setModalIsOpen(false); }; const handleChange = (e) => { const { name, value } = e.target; setNewEvent({ ...newEvent, [name]: value }); }; const handleSubmit = async () => { try { const response = await fetch('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(newEvent) }); const data = await response.json(); setEvents([...events, data]); setModalIsOpen(false); } catch (error) { console.error('Error saving event:', error); } }; return ( <div style={{ height: 500 }}> <Calendar localizer={localizer} events={events} startAccessor="start" endAccessor="end" style={{ margin: '50px' }} selectable={true} onSelectSlot={handleDateSelect} /> const Calendar = ({year, month}) => { const date = new Date(year, month-1, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0) const firstDayOfMonth = new Date(date.getFullYear(), date.getMonth(), 1).getDay() const daysInMonth = new Date(date.getFullYear(), date.getMonth(), 0).getDate() const days = [...Array(firstDayOfMonth).fill(null), ...[...Array(daysInMonth).keys()].map((e,i) => ({day: i+1}))] for(let i = 0; i < events.length; i++) { const event = events[i] const eventDay = days[event.date.day + firstDayOfMonth - 1] console.log(event.date.month, parseInt(month)) if(event.date.month !== parseInt(month)) { continue } if (!Array.isArray(eventDay.events)) { eventDay.events = [] } eventDay.events.push(event) } console.log(days) return ( <> <button onClick={() => setMonth(month - 1)}>‹‹</button> <button onClick={() => setMonth(month + 1)}>››</button> <div className="calendar"> <div className="calendar__header"> <div>Sunday</div> <div>Monday</div> <div>Tuesday</div> <div>Wednesday</div> <div>Thursday</div> <div>Friday</div> <div>Saturday</div> </div> <div className="calendar__body"> {days.map((day, i) => { const events = day && day.events ? day.events.map(e => ( <div className="event">{e.title}</div> )) : null return ( <div> {day ? day.day : ''} {events} </div> ) })} </div> </div> </> ) } ReactDOM.render( <Calendar year="2020" month="1" />, document.getElementById('root') ); <Modal isOpen={modalIsOpen} onRequestClose={closeModal} ariaHideApp={false} > <h2>Add Event</h2> <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}> <div> <label>Title:</label> <input type="text" name="title" value={newEvent.title} onChange={handleChange} /> </div> <div> <label>Description:</label> <textarea name="description" value={newEvent.description} onChange={handleChange} /> </div> <div> <button type="submit">Save Event</button> <button onClick={closeModal}>Cancel</button> </div> </form> </Modal> </div> ); }; export default CalendarM;
ChatGPT

It seems like you're trying to define two components with the same name Calendar, which is causing a conflict. To resolve this issue, you need to rename one of the components. Here's the modified code:

javascript
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { Calendar, momentLocalizer } from 'react-big-calendar';
import 'react-big-calendar/lib/css/react-big-calendar.css';
import moment from 'moment';
import Modal from 'react-modal';

const localizer = momentLocalizer(moment);

const CalendarM = () => {
  const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);
  const [modalIsOpen, setModalIsOpen] = useState(false);
  const [newEvent, setNewEvent] = useState({
    title: '',
    start: '',
    end: '',
    description: ''
  });

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchEvents();
  }, []);

  const fetchEvents = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await fetch('/api/auth/calendar');
      const data = await response.json();
      setEvents(data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
    }
  };

  const handleDateSelect = (slotInfo) => {
    setNewEvent({
      ...newEvent,
      start: slotInfo.start,
      end: slotInfo.end
    });
    setModalIsOpen(true);
  };

  const closeModal = () => {
    setModalIsOpen(false);
  };

  const handleChange = (e) => {
    const { name, value } = e.target;
    setNewEvent({
      ...newEvent,
      [name]: value
    });
  };

  const handleSubmit = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await fetch('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: {
          'Content-Type': 'application/json'
        },
        body: JSON.stringify(newEvent)
      });
      const data = await response.json();
      setEvents([...events, data]);
      setModalIsOpen(false);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error saving event:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div style={{ height: 500 }}>
      <Calendar
        localizer={localizer}
        events={events}
        startAccessor="start"
        endAccessor="end"
        style={{ margin: '50px' }}
        selectable={true}
        onSelectSlot={handleDateSelect}
      />
      <Modal
        isOpen={modalIsOpen}
        onRequestClose={closeModal}
        ariaHideApp={false}
      >
        <h2>Add Event</h2>
        <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
          <div>
            <label>Title:</label>
            <input
              type="text"
              name="title"
              value={newEvent.title}
              onChange={handleChange}
            />
          </div>
          <div>
            <label>Description:</label>
            <textarea
              name="description"
              value={newEvent.description}
              onChange={handleChange}
            />
          </div>
          <div>
            <button type="submit">Save Event</button>
            <button onClick={closeModal}>Cancel</button>
          </div>
        </form>
      </Modal>
    </div>
  );
};

export default CalendarM;

I've renamed the second Calendar component to CalendarM. This should resolve the conflict and make your code error-free.

You
import * as React from 'react'; import { useEffect, useRef } from 'react'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, Resize, DragAndDrop } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; // import './schedule-component.css'; import { extend } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; // import * as dataSource from './datasource.json'; import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA=='); const CalendarM = () => { const scheduleObj = useRef(null); // const data = extend([], dataSource.zooEventsData, null, true); const onEventRendered = (args) => { let categoryColor = args.data.CategoryColor; if (!args.element || !categoryColor) { return; } if (scheduleObj.current.currentView === 'Agenda') { args.element.firstChild.style.borderLeftColor = categoryColor; } else { args.element.style.backgroundColor = categoryColor; } }; return (<div className='schedule-control-section'> <div className='col-lg-12 control-section'> <div className='control-wrapper'> <ScheduleComponent width='100%' height='650px' selectedDate={new Date(2021, 1, 15)} ref={scheduleObj} eventRendered={onEventRendered}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Resize, DragAndDrop]}/> </ScheduleComponent> </div> </div> </div>); }; export default CalendarM; i want to save my events to my backend and render already saved events for all the usres
ChatGPT

To save events to your backend and render already saved events for all users, you need to perform the following steps:

  1. Save Events to Backend: When a user creates or modifies an event, send a request to your backend API with the event data to save it to your database.

  2. Fetch Events from Backend: When the calendar component mounts, fetch the events from your backend API. You can use the useEffect hook for this purpose.

  3. Render Saved Events: Once you have fetched the events from your backend, render them in the calendar component.

Here's how you can implement these steps in your CalendarM component:

javascript
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, Resize, DragAndDrop } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';
import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base';
import axios from 'axios';

registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA==');

const CalendarM = () => {
    const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);

    useEffect(() => {
        fetchEvents();
    }, []);

    const fetchEvents = async () => {
        try {
            const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar');
            setEvents(response.data);
        } catch (error) {
            console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
        }
    };

    const onEventRendered = (args) => {
        let categoryColor = args.data.CategoryColor;
        if (!args.element || !categoryColor) {
            return;
        }
        if (scheduleObj.current.currentView === 'Agenda') {
            args.element.firstChild.style.borderLeftColor = categoryColor;
        } else {
            args.element.style.backgroundColor = categoryColor;
        }
    };

    return (
        <div className='schedule-control-section'>
            <div className='col-lg-12 control-section'>
                <div className='control-wrapper'>
                    <ScheduleComponent width='100%' height='650px' selectedDate={new Date(2021, 1, 15)} eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} ref={scheduleObj} eventRendered={onEventRendered}>
                        <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Resize, DragAndDrop]} />
                    </ScheduleComponent>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    );
};

export default CalendarM;

In this code:

  • We use the useState hook to maintain the state of events fetched from the backend.
  • In the useEffect hook, we fetch the events from the backend API when the component mounts.
  • We render the fetched events using the eventSettings prop of the ScheduleComponent.

Make sure to replace 'http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar' with the actual endpoint of your backend API that handles event fetching and saving. Also, ensure that your backend API supports the required endpoints for fetching and saving events.

You
ERROR in [eslint] [0] src\ALcomponents\Pages\Calendar.jsx [0] Line 377:13: 'scheduleObj' is not defined no-undef [0] Line 388:149: 'scheduleObj' is not defined no-undef
ChatGPT

The error message indicates that scheduleObj is not defined. This is because scheduleObj is declared as a useRef variable, but it's being referenced without being defined in the onEventRendered function.

To resolve this issue, you need to define scheduleObj using the useRef hook before using it. Here's how you can fix it:

javascript
import React, { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react';
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, Resize, DragAndDrop } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';
import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base';
import axios from 'axios';

registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA==');

const CalendarM = () => {
    const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);
    const scheduleObj = useRef(null); // Define scheduleObj using useRef

    useEffect(() => {
        fetchEvents();
    }, []);

    const fetchEvents = async () => {
        try {
            const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar');
            setEvents(response.data);
        } catch (error) {
            console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
        }
    };

    const onEventRendered = (args) => {
        let categoryColor = args.data.CategoryColor;
        if (!args.element || !categoryColor) {
            return;
        }
        if (scheduleObj.current.currentView === 'Agenda') {
            args.element.firstChild.style.borderLeftColor = categoryColor;
        } else {
            args.element.style.backgroundColor = categoryColor;
        }
    };

    return (
        <div className='schedule-control-section'>
            <div className='col-lg-12 control-section'>
                <div className='control-wrapper'>
                    <ScheduleComponent width='100%' height='650px' selectedDate={new Date(2021, 1, 15)} eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} ref={scheduleObj} eventRendered={onEventRendered}>
                        <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Resize, DragAndDrop]} />
                    </ScheduleComponent>
                </div>
            </div>
        </div>
    );
};

export default CalendarM;

By defining scheduleObj using the useRef hook at the beginning of the component, you can avoid the "scheduleObj is not defined" error.

ChatGPT

The warning you're seeing indicates that you're passing an invalid prop value to the Route component in React Router. Specifically, the component prop expects a valid React component, but it seems that you're passing an invalid value to it.

To resolve this issue, you need to check the Route components in your application and ensure that the component prop is assigned a valid React component. Here's an example of how a Route component should be structured:

jsx
import React from 'react';
import { Route } from 'react-router-dom';
import MyComponent from './MyComponent';

const App = () => {
  return (
    <div>
      {/* Valid Route component */}
      <Route path="/my-component" component={MyComponent} />
    </div>
  );
};

export default App;

In this example, MyComponent is a valid React component imported from the './MyComponent' file. Make sure that all Route components in your application are structured similarly, with the component prop assigned a valid React component. If you're still encountering the warning after verifying your Route components, there may be an issue elsewhere in your code that's causing the problem.

import React, { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, Resize, DragAndDrop } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; import axios from 'axios'; registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA=='); const CalendarM = () => { const [events, setEvents] = useState([]); const scheduleObj = useRef(null); // Define scheduleObj using useRef useEffect(() => { fetchEvents(); }, []); const fetchEvents = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar'); setEvents(response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching events:', error); } }; const onEventRendered = (args) => { let categoryColor = args.data.CategoryColor; if (!args.element || !categoryColor) { return; } if (scheduleObj.current.currentView === 'Agenda') { args.element.firstChild.style.borderLeftColor = categoryColor; } else { args.element.style.backgroundColor = categoryColor; } }; return ( <div className='schedule-control-section'> <div className='col-lg-12 control-section'> <div className='control-wrapper'> <ScheduleComponent width='100%' height='650px' selectedDate={new Date(2021, 1, 15)} eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} ref={scheduleObj} eventRendered={onEventRendered}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Resize, DragAndDrop]} /> </ScheduleComponent> </div> </div> </div> ); }; export default CalendarM; nothing is visible on calendar
ChatGPT

If nothing is visible on the calendar, there could be several reasons for this issue. Here are some steps you can take to troubleshoot and resolve the problem:

  1. Check Event Data: Ensure that the events fetched from the backend are valid and properly formatted. You can console.log response.data in the fetchEvents function to see if the data is being fetched correctly.

  2. Verify Event Settings: Make sure that the eventSettings prop of the ScheduleComponent is correctly configured to use the fetched events data. Ensure that the dataSource property of eventSettings is assigned the events state variable.

  3. Check Date Range: Verify that the selectedDate prop of the ScheduleComponent is set to a valid date. It should be a JavaScript Date object representing the date to be initially displayed on the calendar.

  4. Inspect Console for Errors: Check your browser's console for any error messages that may provide clues about what's going wrong. Look for any network request errors, JavaScript exceptions, or warnings that could indicate issues with the calendar component or its configuration.

  5. Ensure Proper Styling: Make sure that the calendar component is rendered with proper dimensions and styling. Sometimes, CSS issues can cause components to appear invisible or not display correctly.

  6. Verify License: Double-check that the Syncfusion license key is correctly registered and applied. If the license key is invalid or not registered, it may affect the rendering of the calendar component.

By following these steps and troubleshooting each potential issue, you should be able to identify and resolve the problem with the calendar not displaying any events. If you're still having trouble, feel free to provide more details or error messages, and I can assist you further.

i want whenever someone add event the event get stored in db
ChatGPT

To store the event in the database whenever someone adds an event, you need to perform the following steps:

  1. Backend API Endpoint: Create an API endpoint on your backend server to handle the POST request for adding events. This endpoint should receive the event data in the request body and then save it to the database.

  2. Frontend Integration: Update your frontend code to send a POST request to the backend API endpoint whenever a new event is added. You can use Axios or Fetch API to make the HTTP request from your React component.

  3. Event Data: Ensure that the event data sent to the backend includes all the necessary information, such as the title, start date, end date, and any other relevant details.

  4. Database Integration: Implement the logic in your backend API endpoint to save the received event data to the database. You can use an ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) library or interact directly with your database using SQL queries, depending on your backend technology stack.

  5. Response Handling: Handle the response from the backend API in your frontend code. If the event is successfully added to the database, you can update the events state in your React component to reflect the changes.

Here's an example of how you can update your frontend code to send a POST request to the backend API when adding a new event:

javascript
const handleAddEvent = async () => {
    try {
        const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', newEvent);
        const eventData = response.data;
        setEvents([...events, eventData]);
        setModalIsOpen(false);
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error adding event:', error);
    }
};

Replace 'http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar' with the actual URL of your backend API endpoint.

Ensure that your backend server is properly configured to receive and handle the POST requests to the specified endpoint and save the event data to the database. Once the backend is set up correctly, adding an event from the frontend should store it in the database.

You
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { Calendar, momentLocalizer } from 'react-big-calendar'; import 'react-big-calendar/lib/css/react-big-calendar.css'; import moment from 'moment'; import Modal from 'react-modal'; import axios from 'axios'; const localizer = momentLocalizer(moment); const CalendarM = () => { const [events, setEvents] = useState([]); const [modalIsOpen, setModalIsOpen] = useState(false); const [newEvent, setNewEvent] = useState({ title: '', start: '', end: '', description: '' }); useEffect(() => { fetchEvents(); }, []); const fetchEvents = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar'); setEvents(response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching events:', error); } }; const handleDateSelect = (slotInfo) => { setNewEvent({ ...newEvent, start: slotInfo.start, end: slotInfo.end }); setModalIsOpen(true); }; const closeModal = () => { setModalIsOpen(false); }; const handleChange = (e) => { const { name, value } = e.target; setNewEvent({ ...newEvent, [name]: value }); }; const handleSubmit = async () => { try { const response = await fetch('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, body: JSON.stringify(newEvent) }); const data = await response.json(); setEvents([...events, data]); setModalIsOpen(false); } catch (error) { console.error('Error saving event:', error); } }; return ( <div style={{ height: 500 }}> <Calendar localizer={localizer} events={events} startAccessor="start" endAccessor="end" style={{ margin: '50px' }} selectable={true} onSelectSlot={handleDateSelect} /> <Modal isOpen={modalIsOpen} onRequestClose={closeModal} ariaHideApp={false} > <h2>Add Event</h2> <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}> <div> <label>Title:</label> <input type="text" name="title" value={newEvent.title} onChange={handleChange} /> </div> <div> <label>Description:</label> <textarea name="description" value={newEvent.description} onChange={handleChange} /> </div> <div> <button type="submit">Save Event</button> <button onClick={closeModal}>Cancel</button> </div> </form> </Modal> </div> ); }; export default CalendarM;d[("get" + method)] is not a function
ChatGPT

It seems like you're encountering an issue with the use of the fetch function. Here's how you can modify your handleSubmit function to use axios consistently for both fetching events and submitting new events:

javascript
const handleSubmit = async () => {
  try {
    const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', newEvent);
    const data = response.data;
    setEvents([...events, data]);
    setModalIsOpen(false);
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error saving event:', error);
  }
};

By using axios.post, you're directly sending a POST request to your backend API endpoint with the new event data in the request body. The response from the backend will contain the newly created event data, which you can then add to the events state in your React component.

Make sure that your backend API endpoint for adding events is correctly configured to handle POST requests and save the event data to the database.

To resolve this issue, you can try the following steps:

  1. Check the Version Compatibility: Ensure that you're using compatible versions of react-big-calendar, moment, and react. Sometimes, compatibility issues arise when different packages have incompatible versions.

  2. Review the Code: Review the code where you're interacting with the react-big-calendar component. Ensure that you're using the correct props and methods according to the documentation.

  3. Check for Typos: Make sure that there are no typos or misspelled words in your code, especially in function names or prop names.

  4. Update Dependencies: If you're using outdated versions of any dependencies, consider updating them to the latest versions to see if the issue is resolved.

  5. Debugging: If the error persists, try debugging your code by adding console.log statements or using browser developer tools to identify the exact location where the error occurs. This can help you pinpoint the problem more accurately.

  6. Consult Documentation: Refer to the documentation of react-big-calendar to ensure that you're using the correct syntax and methods.

Without seeing the exact code where the error occurs or knowing more details about your environment, it's challenging to provide a precise solution. However, following these steps should help you troubleshoot and resolve the issue.

import React from 'react'; import MyMessage from './MyMessage'; import TheirMessage from './TheirMessage'; import MessageForm from './MessageForm'; const ChatFeed = (props) => { const { chats, activeChat, userName, messages } = props; const chat = chats && chats[activeChat]; const renderReadReceipts = (message, isMyMessage) => chat.people.map((person, index) => person.last_read === message.id && ( <div key={read_${index}} className="read-receipt" style={{ float: isMyMessage ? 'right' : 'left', backgroundImage: person.person.avatar && url(${person.person.avatar}), }} /> )); const renderMessages = () => { const keys = Object.keys(messages); return keys.map((key, index) => { const message = messages[key]; const lastMessageKey = index === 0 ? null : keys[index - 1]; const isMyMessage = userName === message.sender.username; return ( <div key={msg_${index}} style={{ width: '100%' }}> <div className="message-block"> {isMyMessage ? <MyMessage message={message} /> : <TheirMessage message={message} lastMessage={messages[lastMessageKey]} />} </div> <div className="read-receipts" style={{ marginRight: isMyMessage ? ChatGPT

The error you're encountering is due to incorrect string interpolation syntax in the key attribute of the JSX element inside the renderReadReceipts function. Instead of using ${} for interpolation, you should use backticks (``) to define a template literal.

Here's the corrected code:

javascript
const renderReadReceipts = (message, isMyMessage) => chat.people.map((person, index) => person.last_read === message.id && (
    <div
      key={`read_${index}`}
      className="read-receipt"
      style={{
        float: isMyMessage ? 'right' : 'left',
        backgroundImage: person.person.avatar && `url(${person.person.avatar})`,
      }}
    />
  ));

By using backticks (), you can interpolate variables or expressions within the template literal using ${}` syntax. This should resolve the syntax error you're encountering.

ChatGPT

The error you're encountering is due to incorrect string interpolation syntax in the key attribute of the JSX element inside the renderMessages function. Instead of using ${} for interpolation, you should use backticks (``) to define a template literal.

Here's the corrected code:

javascript
const renderMessages = () => {
    const keys = Object.keys(messages);

    return keys.map((key, index) => {
      const message = messages[key];
      const lastMessageKey = index === 0 ? null : keys[index - 1];
      const isMyMessage = userName === message.sender.username;

      return (
        <div key={`msg_${index}`} style={{ width: '100%' }}>
          <div className="message-block">
            {isMyMessage
              ? <MyMessage message={message} />
              : <TheirMessage message={message} lastMessage={messages[lastMessageKey]} />}
          </div>
          <div className="read-receipts" style={{ marginRight: isMyMessage ? '18px' : '0px', marginLeft: isMyMessage ? '0px' : '68px' }}>
            {renderReadReceipts(message, isMyMessage)}
          </div>
        </div>
      );
    });
  };

By using backticks (), you can interpolate variables or expressions within the template literal using ${}` syntax. This should resolve the syntax error you're encountering.

You
import React from "react"; const TheirMessage = ({ lastMessage, message }) => { const isFirstMessageByUser = !lastMessage || lastMessage.sender.username !== message.sender.username; return ( <div className="message-row"> {isFirstMessageByUser && ( <div className="message-avatar" style={{ backgroundImage: message.sender && url(${message.sender.avatar}) }} /> )} {message.attachments && message.attachments.length > 0 ? ( <img src={message.attachments[0].file} alt="message-attachment" className="message-image" style={{ marginLeft: isFirstMessageByUser ? '4px' : '48px' }} /> ) : ( <div className="message" style={{ float: 'left', backgroundColor: '#CABCDC', marginLeft: isFirstMessageByUser ? '4px' : '48px' }}> {message.text} </div> )} </div> ); }; export default TheirMessage;Module build failed (from ./node_modules/babel-loader/lib/index.js): SyntaxError: C:\TY PROJECT\rahber\FrontEnd\src\ALcomponents\Chat\TheirMessage.jsx: Unexpected token, expected "," (10:61) 8 | <div 9 | className="message-avatar" > 10 | style={{ backgroundImage: message.sender && url(${message.sender.avatar}) }} | ^ 11 | /> 12 | )} 13 | {message.attachments && message.attachments.length > 0
ChatGPT

The error you're encountering is due to incorrect usage of string interpolation within the inline styles of the JSX element in your TheirMessage component. Instead of using ${} for interpolation, you should use backticks (``) to define a template literal.

Here's the corrected code:

javascript
import React from "react";

const TheirMessage = ({ lastMessage, message }) => {
    const isFirstMessageByUser = !lastMessage || lastMessage.sender.username !== message.sender.username;
  
    return (
      <div className="message-row">
        {isFirstMessageByUser && (
          <div
            className="message-avatar"
            style={{ backgroundImage: message.sender && `url(${message.sender.avatar})` }}
          />
        )}
        {message.attachments && message.attachments.length > 0
          ? (
            <img
              src={message.attachments[0].file}
              alt="message-attachment"
              className="message-image"
              style={{ marginLeft: isFirstMessageByUser ? '4px' : '48px' }}
            />
          )
          : (
            <div className="message" style={{ float: 'left', backgroundColor: '#CABCDC', marginLeft: isFirstMessageByUser ? '4px' : '48px' }}>
              {message.text}
            </div>
          )}
      </div>
    );
};

export default TheirMessage;

By using backticks (), you can interpolate variables or expressions within the template literal using ${}` syntax. This should resolve the syntax error you're encountering.

You
import React from 'react'; import { ChatEngine } from 'react-chat-engine'; import ChatFeed from './ChatFeed'; import LoginForm from './ChatFeed'; import './Chatfinal.css'; const projectID = '69edd9cd-858d-430e-8f5a-a862a65c4cf2'; const Chatfinal = () => { if (!localStorage.getItem('username')) return <LoginForm />; return ( <ChatEngine height="100vh" projectID={projectID} userName={localStorage.getItem('username')} userSecret={localStorage.getItem('password')} renderChatFeed={(chatAppProps) => <ChatFeed {...chatAppProps} />} onNewMessage={() => new Audio('https://chat-engine-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/click.mp3').play()} /> ); }; // infinite scroll, logout, more customizations... export default Chatfinal;getting blank page
ChatGPT

It seems that you are importing the LoginForm component incorrectly in your Chatfinal component. Instead of importing the ChatFeed component, you have imported the LoginForm component again. This might be causing the blank page issue.

Here's the corrected import statement for your Chatfinal component:

javascript
import LoginForm from './LoginForm';

Make sure that you have the LoginForm component defined in a separate file named LoginForm.jsx or LoginForm.js and located in the same directory as your Chatfinal component.

After correcting the import statement, your Chatfinal component should render the login form correctly when the username is not stored in the local storage.

display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center; } .input { color: #333; font-size: 1.2rem; margin: 0 auto; padding: 1.5rem 2rem; border-radius: 0.2rem; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border: none; width: 90%; display: block; border-bottom: 0.3rem solid transparent; transition: all 0.3s; outline: none; margin-bottom: 25px; } .form { width: 400px; } .title { text-align: center; color: white; margin-bottom: 30px; width: 100%; font-size: 2.3em;; } .button { border-radius: 4px; border: none; background-color: white; color: black; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-size: 22px; padding: 20px; width: 200px; transition: all 0.4s; cursor: pointer; margin: 5px; width: 90%; } .button span { cursor: pointer; display: inline-block; position: relative; transition: 0.4s; } .button span:after { content: '\00bb'; position: absolute; opacity: 0; top: 0; right: -20px; transition: 0.5s; } .button:hover span { padding-right: 25px; } .button:hover span:after { opacity: 1; right: 0; }i want this css to apply on only one page but its getting applied on every page
ChatGPT

To apply CSS styles to only one page/component in your React application, you can use CSS modules or inline styles specific to that component. Here's how you can achieve it using CSS modules:

  1. Create a CSS file with your styles, let's say Chatfinal.module.css:
css
/* Chatfinal.module.css */

.chat {
  font-family: Avenir, -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, Segoe UI, Roboto, Helvetica Neue, Arial, Noto Sans, sans-serif, Apple Color Emoji, Segoe UI Emoji, Segoe UI Symbol, Noto Color Emoji;
  letter-spacing: 0.5px;
  margin-left: 75px;
  margin-top: 60px;
}

/* Add other styles specific to the Chatfinal component */
  1. Import the CSS file in your Chatfinal component:
javascript
import React from 'react';
import { ChatEngine } from 'react-chat-engine';
import ChatFeed from './ChatFeed';
import LoginForm from './LoginForm';
import styles from './Chatfinal.module.css'; // Import CSS module

const projectID = '69edd9cd-858d-430e-8f5a-a862a65c4cf2';

const Chatfinal = () => {
  if (!localStorage.getItem('username')) return <LoginForm />;

  return (
    <div className={styles.chat}> {/* Use className from CSS module */}
      <ChatEngine
        height="100vh"
        projectID={projectID}
        userName={localStorage.getItem('username')}
        userSecret={localStorage.getItem('password')}
        renderChatFeed={(chatAppProps) => <ChatFeed {...chatAppProps} />}
        onNewMessage={() => new Audio('https://chat-engine-assets.s3.amazonaws.com/click.mp3').play()}
      />
    </div>
  );
};

export default Chatfinal;

By using CSS modules, the styles defined in Chatfinal.module.css will only apply to the Chatfinal component and won't affect other components in your application.

ChatGPT

To place the .image-button and .send-button in one line, you can wrap them in a container and apply flexbox properties to that container. Here's how you can do it:

css
.button-container {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: space-between;
  align-items: center;
}

Then, wrap your buttons in a container with the button-container class:

jsx
<div className="button-container">
  <button className="image-button">Image Button</button>
  <button className="send-button">Send Button</button>
</div>

This will ensure that the buttons are placed side by side horizontally. Adjust the styles as needed to achieve the desired appearance.

css
.message-form-container {
  position: absolute;
  bottom: 150px; /* Adjust the distance from the bottom as needed */
  width: calc(100% - 8px);
  height: 50px; /* Set the desired height */
  padding: 10px;
  background-color: rgb(240, 240, 240);
  display: flex;
  align-items: center;
}

.form .message-form {
  height: 5px; /* You can remove this line */
}

.message-form {
  overflow: hidden;
  border-radius: 6px;
  border: 1px solid #3b2a50;
  background-color: white;
  height: 30px; /* Adjust the height of the form as needed */
  display: flex;
  justify-content: space-between;
  align-items: center;
}

.message-input {
  height: 18px;
  width: calc(100% - 132px);
  background-color: white;
  border: 1px solid white;
  padding: 0px 18px;
  outline: none;
  font-size: 15px;
}

  cursor: pointer;
  padding: 0px 12px;
}

.send-button {
  height: 30px; /* Adjust the height of the button as needed */
  background-color: white;
  border: 1px solid white;
  padding: 0px 18px;
  cursor: pointer;

import * as ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import * as React from 'react'; import { useEffect, useRef } from 'react'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, EventRenderedArgs, Inject, Resize, DragAndDrop } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import './schedule-component.css'; import { extend } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; // import * as dataSource from './datasource.json'; /** * Schedule local data sample */ const LocalData = () => { const scheduleObj = useRef<ScheduleComponent>(null); const data: Record<string, any>[] = extend([], (dataSource as Record<string, any>).zooEventsData, null, true) as Record<string, any>[]; const onEventRendered = (args: EventRenderedArgs): void => { let categoryColor: string = args.data.CategoryColor as string; if (!args.element || !categoryColor) { return; } if (scheduleObj.current.currentView === 'Agenda') { (args.element.firstChild as HTMLElement).style.borderLeftColor = categoryColor; } else { args.element.style.backgroundColor = categoryColor; } } return ( <div className='schedule-control-section'> <div className='col-lg-12 control-section'> <div className='control-wrapper'> <ScheduleComponent width='100%' height='650px' selectedDate={new Date(2021, 1, 15)} ref={scheduleObj} eventSettings={{ dataSource: data }} eventRendered={onEventRendered}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Resize, DragAndDrop]} /> </ScheduleComponent> </div> </div> </div> ); } export default LocalData;[1] 24 | } else { [1] 25 | args.element.style.backgroundColor = categoryColor;[1] [1] Compiling... [1] Compiled with warnings. [1] [1] [eslint] [1] src\ALcomponents\Pages\Calendar.jsx [1] Line 305:10: 'useEffect' is defined but never used no-unused-vars [1] Line 308:10: 'extend' is defined but never used no-unused-vars [1] [1] Search for the keywords to learn more about each warning. [1] 13 | const LocalData = () => { [1] 14 | const scheduleObj = useRef<ScheduleComponent>(null); [1] > 15 | const data: Record<string, any>[] = extend([], (dataSource as Record<string, any>).zooEventsData, null, true) as Record<string, any>[]; [1] | ^^^^^^^^^^ [1] 16 | [1] 17 | const onEventRendered = (args: EventRenderedArgs): void => { [1] 18 | let categoryColor: string = args.data.CategoryColor as string; [1] [1] ERROR in src/ALcomponents/Pages/Calendar/local-data.tsx:15:101 [1] TS2345: Argument of type 'null' is not assignable to parameter of type 'Object | undefined'. [1] 13 | const LocalData = () => { [1] 14 | const scheduleObj = useRef<ScheduleComponent>(null); [1] > 15 | const data: Record<string, any>[] = extend([], (dataSource as Record<string, any>).zooEventsData, null, true) as Record<string, any>[]; [1] | ^^^^ [1] 16 | [1] 17 | const onEventRendered = (args: EventRenderedArgs): void => { [1] 18 | let categoryColor: string = args.data.CategoryColor as string; [1] [1] ERROR in src/ALcomponents/Pages/Calendar/local-data.tsx:22:9 [1] TS18047: 'scheduleObj.current' is possibly 'null'. [1] 20 | return; [1] 21 | } [1] > 22 | if (scheduleObj.current.currentView === 'Agenda') { [1] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ [1] 23 | (args.element.firstChild as HTMLElement).style.borderLeftColor = categoryColor; [1] 24 | } else { [1] 25 | args.element.style.backgroundColor = categoryColor;
ChatGPT

It seems like there are a few issues in your code:

  1. Unused Variables and Imports: You have some unused variables and imports in your code, which result in warnings during compilation. You can remove them or use them appropriately.

  2. Missing DataSource: The TypeScript compiler is showing an error because it cannot find the dataSource variable. You may need to import or define the dataSource variable properly.

  3. Possibly Null Reference: TypeScript is warning about the possibility of scheduleObj.current being null. You can handle this by adding a null check before accessing scheduleObj.current.currentView.

Here's the updated code with these issues addressed:

typescript
import * as ReactDOM from 'react-dom';
import * as React from 'react';
import { useRef } from 'react';
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, EventRenderedArgs, Inject, Resize, DragAndDrop } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';
import './schedule-component.css';
import { extend } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base';
import dataSource from './datasource.json'; // Assuming dataSource is a JSON file in the same directory

const LocalData = () => {
  const scheduleObj = useRef<ScheduleComponent>(null);
  const data: Record<string, any>[] = extend([], dataSource.zooEventsData, null, true) as Record<string, any>[];

  const onEventRendered = (args: EventRenderedArgs): void => {
    let categoryColor: string = args.data.CategoryColor as string;
    if (!args.element || !categoryColor || !scheduleObj.current) {
      return;
    }
    if (scheduleObj.current.currentView === 'Agenda') {
      (args.element.firstChild as HTMLElement).style.borderLeftColor = categoryColor;
    } else {
      args.element.style.backgroundColor = categoryColor;
    }
  }

  return (
    <div className='schedule-control-section'>
      <div className='col-lg-12 control-section'>
        <div className='control-wrapper'>
          <ScheduleComponent width='100%' height='650px' selectedDate={new Date(2021, 1, 15)} ref={scheduleObj} eventSettings={{ dataSource: data }} eventRendered={onEventRendered}>
            <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Resize, DragAndDrop]} />
          </ScheduleComponent>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}

export default LocalData;

Make sure to adjust the import path of dataSource according to your project structure. Also, ensure that the JSON file contains the correct data structure expected by the application.

You
import * as React from 'react'; import * as ReactDOM from "react-dom"; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import { DataManager, ODataV4Adaptor } from '@syncfusion/ej2-data'; const App = () => { let dataManager = new DataManager({ url: 'https://services.odata.org/V4/Northwind/Northwind.svc/Orders/', adaptor: new ODataV4Adaptor() }); const fieldsData = { id: 'Id', subject: { name: 'ShipName' }, location: { name: 'ShipCountry' }, description: { name: 'ShipAddress' }, startTime: { name: 'OrderDate' }, endTime: { name: 'RequiredDate' }, recurrenceRule: { name: 'ShipRegion' } } const eventSettings = { includeFiltersInQuery: true, dataSource: dataManager, fields: fieldsData } return (<ScheduleComponent height='550px' currentView='Month' selectedDate={new Date(1996, 6, 9)} readonly={true} eventSettings={eventSettings}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent>); }; const root = ReactDOM.createRoot(document.getElementById('schedule')); root.render(<App />);explain can i use my own mongoDB database here and save the events and render the events from it usingthis code or do i need other code
3 / 3
ChatGPT

Yes, you can use your own MongoDB database to save events and render them using the provided code. However, you will need to make some modifications to the code to integrate it with MongoDB.

Here's how you can do it:

  1. Server-side Implementation: You need to create an API on your server to handle CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) for events. This API will interact with your MongoDB database to store and retrieve events.

  2. API Endpoints: Create endpoints for fetching events, creating new events, updating existing events, and deleting events. These endpoints will handle HTTP requests from your React application.

  3. React Integration: Modify the App component to make HTTP requests to your API endpoints. When the component mounts, fetch the events from your MongoDB database and pass them to the ScheduleComponent as the dataSource.

  4. Event Schema: Ensure that the structure of the events in your MongoDB database matches the fieldsData configuration in the App component. You may need to adjust the schema in your database to match the fields expected by the ScheduleComponent.

  5. Authentication: If your application requires authentication, make sure to implement it in both the server-side API and the React application. You may need to handle user authentication and authorization to ensure that users can only access and modify their own events.

  6. Error Handling: Implement error handling in your React application to handle cases where the API requests fail. Display appropriate error messages to the user if there are any issues with fetching or saving events.

By following these steps, you can integrate your MongoDB database with the provided code to save and render events in your React application using the Syncfusion ScheduleComponent.

You
what changes should i make in the code to use my db
ChatGPT

To integrate your MongoDB database with the provided code, you need to make several changes in both the backend and the frontend parts of your application. Below are the steps you should follow:

Backend Changes (Node.js with Express)

  1. Set Up MongoDB Connection: Connect your Node.js backend to your MongoDB database. You can use a library like Mongoose for this purpose.

  2. Create API Endpoints: Implement CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete) for managing events in your MongoDB database. Define routes for these operations in your Express application.

  3. Define Event Schema: Define a schema for events in your MongoDB database. This schema should match the structure expected by your frontend application.

  4. Handle CORS: If your frontend and backend are hosted on different domains, you may need to handle Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) to allow requests from your frontend to your backend.

Frontend Changes (React)

  1. Fetch Events from API: Modify your React frontend to fetch events from your backend API instead of using hardcoded data or the provided data manager.

  2. Send Events to API: When creating or updating events, send the data to your backend API to store it in your MongoDB database.

  3. Update Event Rendering: Update the frontend code to render events fetched from your API. Make sure to handle any differences in the data structure between the hardcoded data and the data stored in your MongoDB database.

  4. Handle Authentication: If your application requires user authentication, implement authentication mechanisms in your frontend and backend to secure access to the API endpoints.

  5. Error Handling: Implement error handling in your frontend code to handle cases where API requests fail, and display appropriate error messages to the user.

Here's a high-level example of how you might modify your frontend code to fetch events from your backend API:

javascript
import * as React from 'react';
import * as ReactDOM from "react-dom";
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';

const App = () => {
    const [events, setEvents] = React.useState([]);

    React.useEffect(() => {
        fetchEventsFromAPI(); // Fetch events when the component mounts
    }, []);

    const fetchEventsFromAPI = async () => {
        try {
            const response = await fetch('/api/events');
            if (!response.ok) {
                throw new Error('Failed to fetch events');
            }
            const data = await response.json();
            setEvents(data);
        } catch (error) {
            console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
        }
    };

    const fieldsData = {
        // Define fields mapping as per your backend schema
    };

    const eventSettings = { dataSource: events, fields: fieldsData };

    return (
        <ScheduleComponent height='550px' currentView='Month' selectedDate={new Date()} eventSettings={eventSettings}>
            <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
        </ScheduleComponent>
    );
};

const root = ReactDOM.createRoot(document.getElementById('schedule'));
root.render(<App />);

In this example, /api/events is the endpoint on your backend server that returns the list of events from your MongoDB database. Make sure to replace it with the actual endpoint URL of your API.

Remember to make similar modifications to handle event creation, updating, and deletion as well. Ensure that your backend API handles these operations correctly and interacts with your MongoDB database accordingly.

You
src\ALcomponents\Pages\Calendar.jsx [1] Line 431:9: 'title' is not defined no-undef [1] Line 432:9: 'startDate' is not defined no-undef [1] Line 433:9: 'endDate' is not defined no-undef [1] Line 434:9: 'description' is not defined no-undef import * as React from 'react'; import * as ReactDOM from "react-dom"; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; const CalendarM = () => { const [events, setEvents] = React.useState([]); React.useEffect(() => { fetchEventsFromAPI(); // Fetch events when the component mounts }, []); const fetchEventsFromAPI = async () => { try { const response = await fetch('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar'); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error('Failed to fetch events'); } const data = await response.json(); setEvents(data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching events:', error); } }; const fieldsData = { title, startDate, endDate, description }; const eventSettings = { dataSource: events, fields: fieldsData }; return ( <ScheduleComponent height='550px' currentView='Month' selectedDate={new Date()} eventSettings={eventSettings}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent> ); }; export default CalendarM;
ChatGPT

In your Calendar.jsx file, you are referencing variables title, startDate, endDate, and description in the fieldsData object, but these variables are not defined anywhere in your component. You need to make sure that these variables hold the correct field names as per your event data structure.

Assuming your event data structure has fields named title, startDate, endDate, and description, you can directly specify them as strings in the fieldsData object. Here's the corrected code:

javascript
import * as React from 'react';
import * as ReactDOM from "react-dom";
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';

const CalendarM = () => {
    const [events, setEvents] = React.useState([]);

    React.useEffect(() => {
        fetchEventsFromAPI(); // Fetch events when the component mounts
    }, []);

    const fetchEventsFromAPI = async () => {
        try {
            const response = await fetch('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar');
            if (!response.ok) {
                throw new Error('Failed to fetch events');
            }
            const data = await response.json();
            setEvents(data);
        } catch (error) {
            console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
        }
    };

    const fieldsData = {
        title: 'title',
        startDate: 'startDate',
        endDate: 'endDate',
        description: 'description'
    };

    const eventSettings = { dataSource: events, fields: fieldsData };

    return (
        <ScheduleComponent height='550px' currentView='Month' selectedDate={new Date()} eventSettings={eventSettings}>
            <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
        </ScheduleComponent>
    );
};

export default CalendarM;

Make sure to replace 'title', 'startDate', 'endDate', and 'description' with the actual field names from your event data structure that you receive from the API.

You
import * as React from 'react'; import * as ReactDOM from "react-dom"; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import { DataManager, ODataV4Adaptor } from '@syncfusion/ej2-data'; import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA=='); const CalendarM = () => { let dataManager = new DataManager({ url: 'http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', adaptor: new ODataV4Adaptor() }); const fieldsData = { id: 'Id', subject: { name: 'ShipName' }, location: { name: 'ShipCountry' }, description: { name: 'ShipAddress' }, startTime: { name: 'OrderDate' }, endTime: { name: 'RequiredDate' }, recurrenceRule: { name: 'ShipRegion' } } const eventSettings = { includeFiltersInQuery: true, dataSource: dataManager, fields: fieldsData } return (<ScheduleComponent height='550px' currentView='Month' selectedDate={new Date(1996, 6, 9)} readonly={true} eventSettings={eventSettings}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent>); }; export default CalendarM; const mongoose = require('mongoose'); const Schema = mongoose.Schema; const eventSchema = new Schema({ title: { type: String, required: true }, startDate: { type: Date, required: true }, endDate: { type: Date, required: true }, description: String }); const Event = mongoose.model('Event', eventSchema); module.exports = Event; router.post('/calendar', async (req, res) => { const event = new Event({ title: req.body.title, startDate: req.body.startDate, endDate: req.body.endDate, description: req.body.description }); try { const newEvent = await event.save(); res.status(201).json(newEvent); } catch (error) { res.status(400).json({ message: error.message }); } }); router.get('/calendar', async (req, res) => { try { const events = await Event.find(); res.json(events); } catch (error) { res.status(500).json({ message: error.message }); } });is the front end code correct with respect to backend why im unable to see already created events of db in calendar and why new events not getting stored in db

ChatGPT

Your front-end code appears to be correct in terms of integrating with the back end. However, there are a few potential issues to check:

  1. Database Connection: Ensure that your MongoDB connection is properly configured in your back-end server. Check that you can connect to your MongoDB instance and perform CRUD operations successfully outside of the Express routes.

  2. Route Configuration: Make sure that your Express routes are correctly configured and that there are no conflicting routes or middleware interfering with the /calendar endpoints.

  3. Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS): Since your front end is running on a different origin (http://localhost:3000 assuming it's the default create-react-app development server), you need to ensure that CORS is properly configured in your Express server to allow requests from the front end. You can use the cors middleware in your Express app for this purpose.

  4. Request Body: Ensure that your front-end code is sending the correct data in the request body when creating new events. Double-check that the title, startDate, endDate, and description fields are being sent correctly.

  5. Error Handling: Check your server logs and network tab in the browser's developer tools for any error messages or failed requests. Ensure that error messages from the server are properly propagated to the front end for debugging purposes.

  6. Front-end Rendering: Ensure that the ScheduleComponent is being rendered properly in your React application and that it is able to fetch data from the /calendar endpoint.

By thoroughly checking these aspects, you should be able to diagnose and resolve any issues preventing your front end from displaying existing events from the database or storing new events successfully.

You
using System; using System.Collections.Generic; using System.Linq; using System.Web; using System.Web.Mvc; using ScheduleSample.Models; namespace ScheduleSample.Controllers { public class HomeController : Controller { ScheduleDataDataContext db = new ScheduleDataDataContext(); public ActionResult Index() { return View(); } public JsonResult LoadData() // Here we get the Start and End Date and based on that can filter the data and return to Scheduler { var data = db.ScheduleEventDatas.ToList(); return Json(data, JsonRequestBehavior.AllowGet); } [HttpPost] public JsonResult UpdateData(EditParams param) { if (param.action == "insert" || (param.action == "batch" && param.added != null)) // this block of code will execute while inserting the appointments { var value = (param.action == "insert") ? param.value : param.added[0]; int intMax = db.ScheduleEventDatas.ToList().Count > 0 ? db.ScheduleEventDatas.ToList().Max(p => p.Id) : 1; DateTime startTime = Convert.ToDateTime(value.StartTime); DateTime endTime = Convert.ToDateTime(value.EndTime); ScheduleEventData appointment = new ScheduleEventData() { Id = intMax + 1, StartTime = startTime.ToLocalTime(), EndTime = endTime.ToLocalTime(), Subject = value.Subject, IsAllDay = value.IsAllDay, StartTimezone = value.StartTimezone, EndTimezone = value.EndTimezone, RecurrenceRule = value.RecurrenceRule, RecurrenceID = value.RecurrenceID, RecurrenceException = value.RecurrenceException }; db.ScheduleEventDatas.InsertOnSubmit(appointment); db.SubmitChanges(); } if (param.action == "update" || (param.action == "batch" && param.changed != null)) // this block of code will execute while updating the appointment { var value = (param.action == "update") ? param.value : param.changed[0]; var filterData = db.ScheduleEventDatas.Where(c => c.Id == Convert.ToInt32(value.Id)); if (filterData.Count() > 0) { DateTime startTime = Convert.ToDateTime(value.StartTime); DateTime endTime = Convert.ToDateTime(value.EndTime); ScheduleEventData appointment = db.ScheduleEventDatas.Single(A => A.Id == Convert.ToInt32(value.Id)); appointment.StartTime = startTime.ToLocalTime(); appointment.EndTime = endTime.ToLocalTime(); appointment.StartTimezone = value.StartTimezone; appointment.EndTimezone = value.EndTimezone; appointment.Subject = value.Subject; appointment.IsAllDay = value.IsAllDay; appointment.RecurrenceRule = value.RecurrenceRule; appointment.RecurrenceID = value.RecurrenceID; appointment.RecurrenceException = value.RecurrenceException; } db.SubmitChanges(); } if (param.action == "remove" || (param.action == "batch" && param.deleted != null)) // this block of code will execute while removing the appointment { if (param.action == "remove") { int key = Convert.ToInt32(param.key); ScheduleEventData appointment = db.ScheduleEventDatas.Where(c => c.Id == key).FirstOrDefault(); if (appointment != null) db.ScheduleEventDatas.DeleteOnSubmit(appointment); } else { foreach (var apps in param.deleted) { ScheduleEventData appointment = db.ScheduleEventDatas.Where(c => c.Id == apps.Id).FirstOrDefault(); if (appointment != null) db.ScheduleEventDatas.DeleteOnSubmit(appointment); } } db.SubmitChanges(); } var data = db.ScheduleEventDatas.ToList(); return Json(data, JsonRequestBehavior.AllowGet); } public class EditParams { public string key { get; set; } public string action { get; set; } public List<ScheduleEventData> added { get; set; } public List<ScheduleEventData> changed { get; set; } public List<ScheduleEventData> deleted { get; set; } public ScheduleEventData value { get; set; } } } }
ChatGPT

The provided C# code is an ASP.NET MVC controller responsible for handling requests related to a scheduling application. Here's a breakdown of what each part does:

  1. Index Action: This action returns the main view of the application, likely containing the scheduling component.

  2. LoadData Action: This action returns JSON data representing the schedule events. It fetches the data from the database and returns it as JSON.

  3. UpdateData Action: This action handles CRUD operations for the schedule events. Depending on the value of the action parameter, it either inserts, updates, or removes events from the database. It receives data in JSON format and processes it accordingly.

  4. EditParams Class: This class represents the structure of the data received by the UpdateData action. It contains properties like key, action, added, changed, deleted, and value, which correspond to different aspects of the data being updated.

  5. ScheduleEventData Class: This class represents the structure of a schedule event. It likely mirrors the schema of the database table storing schedule events.

Overall, this controller manages the interaction between the front end (likely a JavaScript scheduling component) and the back end (the database storing schedule data). It handles loading existing schedule data and processing CRUD operations to update the schedule.

how can i connect my MongoDB db to the syncfusion calendar schedular frontend code import * as React from 'react'; import * as ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; const App = () => { return (<ScheduleComponent> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]}/> </ScheduleComponent>); }; export default App; ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.getElementById("schedule"));
3 / 3
ChatGPT

To connect your MongoDB database to the Syncfusion calendar scheduler frontend code, you'll need to create a backend API that interacts with the database and serves the required data to your frontend code. Here's a general outline of the steps you'll need to follow:

  1. Set up a backend server: You can use Node.js with Express.js to create a backend server that will handle requests from your frontend and interact with the MongoDB database.

  2. Define routes for CRUD operations: Create routes in your backend server to handle CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for events in your MongoDB database. For example, you can have routes for fetching events, creating new events, updating existing events, and deleting events.

  3. Connect to MongoDB: Use a MongoDB library like Mongoose to connect your Node.js backend server to your MongoDB database. This allows you to perform database operations using JavaScript.

  4. Implement API endpoints: Implement the logic for fetching, creating, updating, and deleting events in your MongoDB database within your backend API endpoints.

  5. Fetch data in your frontend: Modify your React frontend code to make HTTP requests to your backend API endpoints to fetch the data from your MongoDB database. You can use libraries like Axios or the built-in Fetch API to make these requests.

  6. Render data in Syncfusion calendar: Once you've fetched the data from your MongoDB database in your frontend code, pass this data to the Syncfusion calendar scheduler component to render the events.

Here's an example of how you might modify your frontend code to fetch data from your backend API:

javascript
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';
import axios from 'axios';

const App = () => {
  const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchEvents();
  }, []);

  const fetchEvents = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('/api/events'); // Assuming your backend API endpoint is '/api/events'
      setEvents(response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }}>
      <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
    </ScheduleComponent>
  );
};

ReactDOM.render(<App />, document.getElementById("schedule"));

Replace '/api/events' with the appropriate endpoint URL for fetching events from your backend server. Similarly, implement other CRUD operations in your backend and modify the frontend code accordingly to interact with those endpoints.

It seems like the data returned from your backend API might not be in the expected format that Syncfusion's ScheduleComponent is looking for. Here are a few steps you can take to troubleshoot and fix the issue:

  1. Check the Data Format: Ensure that the data returned from your backend API matches the expected format for the dataSource of the ScheduleComponent. Each event object should have properties such as Id, Subject, StartTime, EndTime, etc.

  2. Verify Data Structure: Make sure that the events state variable in your frontend code is being set correctly with the data returned from the API. You can log the events variable to the console to inspect its structure and contents.

  3. Inspect Network Requests: Use browser developer tools to inspect the network requests and responses when fetching data from your backend API. Verify that the API endpoint is being called correctly and that the response contains the expected data.

  4. Handle Date Format: Ensure that the date format returned from the backend API matches the format expected by the ScheduleComponent. You may need to format the dates appropriately before setting them in the events state.

  5. Check for Errors: Check the browser console for any error messages or warnings that might indicate issues with rendering the calendar or handling the data.

Here's an example of how you can inspect the events variable and log any errors:

javascript
const CalendarM = () => {
  const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchEvents();
  }, []);

  const fetchEvents = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar');
      console.log('Response:', response.data); // Log response data to inspect its structure
      setEvents(response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
    }
  };

  console.log('Events:', events); // Log events state variable to inspect its contents

  return (
    <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }}>
      <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
    </ScheduleComponent>
  );
};

By following these steps and inspecting the data flow between your backend and frontend, you should be able to identify and resolve any issues preventing the events from being displayed on the calendar.
