If you're not getting any response in the console, it suggests that your backend API might not be returning any data. Here are a few steps to troubleshoot this issue:

  1. Verify Backend Endpoint: Double-check that the URL http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar is correct and corresponds to the endpoint that returns calendar events.

  2. Test API Endpoint: Use a tool like Postman or Insomnia to manually test the backend API endpoint. Send a GET request to the URL and verify if it returns the expected data. This will help you determine if the issue is with the frontend or the backend.

  3. Check Backend Implementation: Ensure that your backend server is correctly configured to handle requests to the /api/auth/calendar endpoint. Verify that the endpoint is querying the database and returning the events data in the expected format.

  4. Inspect Network Requests: Use browser developer tools to inspect the network requests being made by your frontend code. Look for any errors or issues in the request and response details.

  5. Enable CORS: If your backend API is hosted on a different domain or port than your frontend, you may need to enable CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) to allow the frontend to make requests to the backend. Check if CORS is properly configured on your backend server.

  6. Check Server Logs: Check the server logs of your backend application for any errors or warnings related to the /api/auth/calendar endpoint. This can help you identify issues with the backend implementation.

Once you've identified the cause of the problem, you can take appropriate steps to fix it and ensure that the backend API returns the expected data. Once the backend API is returning data correctly, the events should be displayed on the calendar in your frontend application.

If the GET request to localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar is working properly in Thunder Client and returning events, but you're not seeing any events displayed in your calendar component, there could be a few reasons for this discrepancy:

  1. Data Format: Ensure that the data returned by the API endpoint is in the correct format expected by the Syncfusion Schedule component. The events data should be an array of objects, where each object represents an event and contains properties like id, subject, startTime, endTime, etc.

  2. Component Configuration: Verify that the eventSettings prop of the ScheduleComponent is correctly configured to use the events state as the data source. Ensure that the data structure matches the expected format.

  3. Rendering Events: Double-check the rendering logic of the events in the ScheduleComponent. Ensure that the component is correctly iterating over the events array and rendering each event on the calendar.

  4. Empty Data Handling: If the events state is initially empty or null, the calendar might not render any events until the data is fetched successfully. Make sure that your component handles the case where events is empty or null gracefully.

  5. Error Handling: Implement error handling in your fetchEvents function to log any errors that occur during the API request. This will help you identify if there are any issues with fetching data from the backend.

  6. Check Network Tab: Use the browser's network tab to inspect the response from the API endpoint when the request is made from your frontend application. Ensure that the response contains the expected events data.

By carefully reviewing these aspects, you should be able to identify the reason why the events are not being displayed in your calendar component despite the successful API response.

[ { "_id": "65ed93d65e75dca94c6ed9f1", "title": "Meeting", "startDate": "2024-02-21T09:00:00.000Z", "endDate": "2024-02-22T17:00:00.000Z", "description": "Discussion on project progress", "__v": 0 } ]
ChatGPT

Thank you for providing the updated response. It seems that the property names in this response are startDate and endDate, which is different from the property names used in your component (start and end).

To ensure compatibility, you need to update your component to use the correct property names. Here's how you can modify your CalendarM component to handle the startDate and endDate properties:

jsx
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';
import axios from 'axios';
import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base';
registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA==');

const CalendarM = () => {
  const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchEvents();
  }, []);

  const fetchEvents = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar');
      setEvents(response.data.map(event => ({
        Id: event._id,
        Subject: event.title,
        StartTime: new Date(event.startDate),
        EndTime: new Date(event.endDate),
        Description: event.description
      })));
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }}>
      <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
    </ScheduleComponent>
  );
};

export default CalendarM;

In this modified component, the fetchEvents function processes the response from the API and maps each event to the expected format with properties Id, Subject, StartTime, EndTime, and Description, which are compatible with the ScheduleComponent. Make sure to adjust the property names as needed to match your specific requirements.

If you're not seeing anything in your calendar, there could be several reasons for this:

import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import axios from 'axios'; import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA=='); const CalendarM = () => { const [events, setEvents] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { fetchEvents(); }, []); const fetchEvents = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar'); setEvents(response.data.map(event => ({ Id: event._id, Subject: event.title, StartTime: new Date(event.startDate), EndTime: new Date(event.endDate), Description: event.description }))); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching events:', error); } }; return ( <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent> ); }; export default CalendarM;i want new created event to save in my db
ChatGPT

To save newly created events in your MongoDB database, you need to implement a mechanism to send the event data from your frontend application to your backend API and then handle the insertion of the event data into the database. Here's how you can achieve it:

  1. Frontend Implementation: Modify your frontend code to include a form or UI component for users to create new events. When the user submits the form or saves the event, send a POST request to your backend API with the event data.

    Here's an example of how you can modify your frontend code to handle event creation:

javascript
const CalendarM = () => {
  const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchEvents();
  }, []);

  const fetchEvents = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar');
      setEvents(response.data.map(event => ({
        Id: event._id,
        Subject: event.title,
        StartTime: new Date(event.startDate),
        EndTime: new Date(event.endDate),
        Description: event.description
      })));
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
    }
  };

  const createEvent = async (newEventData) => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', newEventData);
      setEvents([...events, response.data]); // Update the events list with the newly created event
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error creating event:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }}>
        <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
      </ScheduleComponent>
      {/* Your form or UI component to create new events */}
      {/* Example: <EventForm onCreate={createEvent} /> */}
    </div>
  );
};

  1. Backend Implementation: Implement API endpoints on your backend to handle event creation. When receiving a POST request with event data, insert the event into your MongoDB database.

    Here's an example of how you can implement the backend API using Express.js and Mongoose:

javascript
const express = require('express');
const router = express.Router();
const Event = require('../models/Event');

router.post('/calendar', async (req, res) => {
  const { title, startDate, endDate, description } = req.body;
  const event = new Event({ title, startDate, endDate, description });

  try {
    const newEvent = await event.save();
    res.status(201).json(newEvent);
  } catch (error) {
    res.status(400).json({ message: error.message });
  }
});

Ensure that your backend API is properly configured to handle POST requests to the /api/auth/calendar endpoint and that the event data is correctly inserted into your MongoDB database.

By implementing these changes, newly created events from your frontend application will be sent to your backend API and saved in your MongoDB database.

You
import { Schedule, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda } from '@syncfusion/ej2-schedule'; import { DataManager, UrlAdaptor } from '@syncfusion/ej2-data'; Schedule.Inject(Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda); let dataManager: DataManager = new DataManager({ url: 'Home/GetData', // 'controller/actions' crudUrl: 'Home/UpdateData', adaptor: new UrlAdaptor }); let scheduleObj: Schedule = new Schedule({ height: '550px', selectedDate: new Date(2017, 5, 5), eventSettings: { dataSource: dataManager } }); scheduleObj.appendTo('#Schedule');
ChatGPT

The provided code is using the Syncfusion JavaScript Scheduler library (@syncfusion/ej2-schedule) to render a schedule component and fetch data from the server using AJAX. Here's what each part of the code does:

  1. Importing Modules:

    • Schedule, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda: These are components and views provided by the Syncfusion Scheduler library.
    • DataManager, UrlAdaptor: These are used to interact with remote data sources.

  2. Injecting Components:

    • Schedule.Inject(Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda): Injecting different views into the Schedule component.

  3. Creating DataManager:

    • DataManager is created to manage data retrieval from the server.
    • The url property specifies the URL from which data will be fetched.
    • The crudUrl property specifies the URL for CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete).
    • An UrlAdaptor instance is used to handle data operations.

  4. Creating Schedule Object:

    • Schedule component is instantiated with various settings.
    • height sets the height of the scheduler.
    • selectedDate sets the initially selected date.
    • eventSettings specifies the settings for events, including the dataSource property that specifies the data source for events.

  5. Appending Schedule to the DOM:

    • scheduleObj.appendTo('#Schedule') appends the Scheduler to an HTML element with the ID Schedule.

To make this code work, you need to ensure the following:

  • Implement the server-side endpoints (Home/GetData and Home/UpdateData) to handle data retrieval and CRUD operations.
  • Ensure that the server returns data in the expected format.
  • Include the necessary Syncfusion Scheduler library scripts and stylesheets in your project.
  • Make sure there is an HTML element with the ID Schedule in your page where you want to render the Scheduler.

If you have any specific issues or errors, please provide more details, and I can assist you further.

You
how can i add the new event to my db import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import axios from 'axios'; import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA=='); const CalendarM = () => { const [events, setEvents] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { fetchEvents(); }, []); const fetchEvents = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar'); setEvents(response.data.map(event => ({ Id: event._id, Subject: event.title, StartTime: new Date(event.startDate), EndTime: new Date(event.endDate), Description: event.description }))); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching events:', error); } }; return ( <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent> ); }; export default CalendarM;
ChatGPT

To add a new event to your database when a user creates one in the scheduler, you need to implement the logic for sending the event data to your server and saving it in the database. Here's how you can achieve this:

  1. Frontend Implementation:
javascript
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import ReactDOM from 'react-dom';
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, PopupOpenEventArgs } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';
import axios from 'axios';
import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base';
registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA==');

const CalendarM = () => {
  const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchEvents();
  }, []);

  const fetchEvents = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar');
      setEvents(response.data.map(event => ({
        Id: event._id,
        Subject: event.title,
        StartTime: new Date(event.startDate),
        EndTime: new Date(event.endDate),
        Description: event.description
      })));
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
    }
  };

  const handlePopupOpen = (args: PopupOpenEventArgs) => {
    if (args.type === 'Editor') {
      // Handle the popup open event here
      // You can add custom logic to send the new event data to your server
      // and save it in the database
      const newData = args.data[0]; // Get the new event data
      saveEventToDatabase(newData); // Call a function to save the event to the database
    }
  };

  const saveEventToDatabase = async (eventData) => {
    try {
      // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
      const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventData);
      console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error saving event:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={handlePopupOpen}>
      <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
    </ScheduleComponent>
  );
};

export default CalendarM;

In this code:

  • We've added a new function handlePopupOpen to handle the popup open event of the scheduler editor.
  • Inside this function, we retrieve the new event data from args.data[0].
  • We then call the saveEventToDatabase function to send a POST request to your server to save the new event data.
  • The saveEventToDatabase function makes a POST request to your backend endpoint (http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar) with the new event data.
  1. Backend Implementation:

You need to implement the server-side endpoint (http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar) to handle the POST request and save the new event data in your database. Ensure that the backend endpoint is correctly configured to receive the event data and store it in the database.

By implementing these frontend and backend changes, you'll be able to add new events to your database when users create them in the scheduler.

You
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, PopupOpenEventArgs } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import axios from 'axios'; import { DropDownList } from '@syncfusion/ej2-dropdowns'; import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA=='); const CalendarM = () => { const [events, setEvents] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { fetchEvents(); }, []); const fetchEvents = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar'); setEvents(response.data.map(event => ({ Id: event._id, Subject: event.title, StartTime: new Date(event.startDate), EndTime: new Date(event.endDate), Description: event.description }))); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching events:', error); } }; const onPopupOpen = (args) => { if (args.type === 'Editor') { if (!args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-row')) { let row = document.createElement('div'); row.className = 'custom-field-row'; let formElement = args.element.querySelector('.e-schedule-form'); formElement.firstChild.insertBefore(row, formElement.firstChild.firstChild); let container = document.createElement('div'); container.className = 'custom-field-container'; let inputEle = document.createElement('input'); inputEle.className = 'e-field'; inputEle.setAttribute('name', 'EventType'); container.appendChild(inputEle); row.appendChild(container); let drowDownList = new DropDownList({ dataSource: [ { text: 'Public Event', value: 'public-event' }, { text: 'Maintenance', value: 'maintenance' }, { text: 'Commercial Event', value: 'commercial-event' }, { text: 'Family Event', value: 'family-event' } ], fields: { text: 'text', value: 'value' }, floatLabelType: 'Always', placeholder: 'Event Type' }); drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle); } } } const saveEventToDatabase = async (eventData) => { try { // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventData); console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error saving event:', error); } }; return ( <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={onPopupOpen}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent> ); }; export default CalendarM; event is not getting saved in db
ChatGPT

In your code, the onPopupOpen function is responsible for adding a custom field (EventType) to the event editor popup. However, you haven't integrated any logic to handle the submission of the event with this custom field data.

To save the event in the database with the custom field data, you need to modify the onPopupOpen function to capture the custom field value when the user saves the event, and then include this data in the request sent to the backend for saving.

Here's how you can modify your code to achieve this:

javascript
const onPopupOpen = (args) => {
    if (args.type === 'Editor') {
        if (!args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-row')) {
            let row = document.createElement('div');
            row.className = 'custom-field-row';
            let formElement = args.element.querySelector('.e-schedule-form');
            formElement.firstChild.insertBefore(row, formElement.firstChild.firstChild);
            let container = document.createElement('div');
            container.className = 'custom-field-container';
            let inputEle = document.createElement('input');
            inputEle.className = 'e-field';
            inputEle.setAttribute('name', 'EventType');
            container.appendChild(inputEle);
            row.appendChild(container);
            let drowDownList = new DropDownList({
                dataSource: [
                    { text: 'Public Event', value: 'public-event' },
                    { text: 'Maintenance', value: 'maintenance' },
                    { text: 'Commercial Event', value: 'commercial-event' },
                    { text: 'Family Event', value: 'family-event' }
                ],
                fields: { text: 'text', value: 'value' },
                floatLabelType: 'Always', placeholder: 'Event Type'
            });
            drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle);
        }
    }
};

const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
    try {
        // Get the custom field value from the event editor
        const eventType = args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-container input').value;
        
        // Construct the event data with the custom field value
        const eventData = {
            title: args.data.Subject,
            startDate: args.data.StartTime,
            endDate: args.data.EndTime,
            description: args.data.Description,
            eventType: eventType // Add the custom field value to the event data
        };

        // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
        const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventData);
        console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error saving event:', error);
    }
};

return (
    <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={onPopupOpen} actionComplete={onSaveClick}>
        <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
    </ScheduleComponent>
);

In this updated code:

  • We define a new function onSaveClick to handle the action complete event, which occurs when the user saves an event in the scheduler.
  • Inside onSaveClick, we retrieve the custom field value from the event editor popup and include it in the event data object.
  • Then, we send a POST request to your server to save the new event data, including the custom field value.
  • Finally, we attach onSaveClick to the actionComplete event of the scheduler component to trigger the save operation when the user saves an event.
You
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import ReactDOM from 'react-dom'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, PopupOpenEventArgs } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle); } } }; const onSaveClick = async (args) => { try { // Get the custom field value from the event editor const eventType = args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-container input').value; // Construct the event data with the custom field value const eventData = { title: args.data.Subject, startDate: args.data.StartTime, endDate: args.data.EndTime, description: args.data.Description, eventType: eventType // Add the custom field value to the event data }; // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventData); console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error saving event:', error); } }; return ( <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={onPopupOpen} actionComplete={onSaveClick}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent> ); export default CalendarM;
ChatGPT

The issue in your code seems to be related to the placement of the return statement. In JavaScript, the return statement is used to return a value from a function. However, in your code, the return statement is used outside of a function, which is causing a syntax error.

To fix this issue, you need to wrap the JSX code inside a function component or a functional component body. Here's the corrected code:

javascript
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, PopupOpenEventArgs } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';
import axios from 'axios';
import { DropDownList } from '@syncfusion/ej2-dropdowns';
import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base';
registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA==');

const CalendarM = () => {
  const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchEvents();
  }, []);

  const fetchEvents = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar');
      setEvents(response.data.map(event => ({
        Id: event._id,
        Subject: event.title,
        StartTime: new Date(event.startDate),
        EndTime: new Date(event.endDate),
        Description: event.description
      })));
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
    }
  };

  const onPopupOpen = (args) => {
    if (args.type === 'Editor') {
        if (!args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-row')) {
            let row = document.createElement('div');
            row.className = 'custom-field-row';
            let formElement = args.element.querySelector('.e-schedule-form');
            formElement.firstChild.insertBefore(row, formElement.firstChild.firstChild);
            let container = document.createElement('div');
            container.className = 'custom-field-container';
            let inputEle = document.createElement('input');
            inputEle.className = 'e-field';
            inputEle.setAttribute('name', 'EventType');
            container.appendChild(inputEle);
            row.appendChild(container);
            let drowDownList = new DropDownList({
                dataSource: [
                    { text: 'Public Event', value: 'public-event' },
                    { text: 'Maintenance', value: 'maintenance' },
                    { text: 'Commercial Event', value: 'commercial-event' },
                    { text: 'Family Event', value: 'family-event' }
                ],
                fields: { text: 'text', value: 'value' },
                floatLabelType: 'Always', placeholder: 'Event Type'
            });
            drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle);
        }
    }
};

const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
    try {
        // Get the custom field value from the event editor
        const eventType = args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-container input').value;
        
        // Construct the event data with the custom field value
        const eventData = {
            title: args.data.Subject,
            startDate: args.data.StartTime,
            endDate: args.data.EndTime,
            description: args.data.Description,
            eventType: eventType // Add the custom field value to the event data
        };

        // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
        const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventData);
        console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error saving event:', error);
    }
};

return (
    <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={onPopupOpen} actionComplete={onSaveClick}>
        <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
    </ScheduleComponent>
);
};

export default CalendarM;

In this corrected code:

  • The return statement is inside the CalendarM function component, which contains the JSX code for rendering the ScheduleComponent.
  • Now, the component is defined correctly and should work as expected.
You
Error saving event: TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'querySelector') at ScheduleComponent.onSaveClick (Calendar.jsx:579:1) at Observer.notify (observer.js:89:1) at ComponentBase.trigger (component-base.js:252:1) at Crud.refreshData (crud.js:124:1) at Observer.<anonymous> (crud.js:189:1) at Observer.notify (observer.js:75:1) at ComponentBase.trigger (component-base.js:252:1) at Crud.addEvent (crud.js:167:1) at Observer.<anonymous> (quick-popups.js:1269:1) at Observer.notify (observer.js:75:1)
ChatGPT

The error indicates that the args.element is undefined when trying to access its properties in the onSaveClick function. This error typically occurs when attempting to access properties of an element that doesn't exist or hasn't been rendered yet.

To resolve this issue, you should ensure that args.element exists before attempting to access its properties. You can use optional chaining (?.) to safely access nested properties without throwing errors if any of them are undefined.

Here's how you can modify the onSaveClick function to handle this error:

javascript
const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
    try {
        // Get the custom field value from the event editor
        const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value;
        
        // Check if eventType is undefined, and if so, set it to an empty string
        const eventTypeValue = eventType || '';

        // Construct the event data with the custom field value
        const eventData = {
            title: args.data.Subject,
            startDate: args.data.StartTime,
            endDate: args.data.EndTime,
            description: args.data.Description,
            eventType: eventTypeValue // Add the custom field value to the event data
        };

        // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
        const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventData);
        console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error saving event:', error);
    }
};

By using optional chaining (?.) in args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value, you ensure that the function won't throw an error if args.element is undefined or if any intermediate property is missing. If args.element or any intermediate property is undefined, the expression will simply return undefined, and the function will gracefully handle it without throwing an error.

You
Calendar.jsx:597 Error saving event: AxiosError {message: 'Request failed with status code 400', name: 'AxiosError', code: 'ERR_BAD_REQUEST', config: {…}, request: XMLHttpRequest, …} code : "ERR_BAD_REQUEST" config : {transitional: {…}, adapter: Array(2), transformRequest: Array(1), transformResponse: Array(1), timeout: 0, …} message : "Request failed with status code 400" name : "AxiosError" request : XMLHttpRequest {onreadystatechange: null, readyState: 4, timeout: 0, withCredentials: false, upload: XMLHttpRequestUpload, …} response : config : {transitional: {…}, adapter: Array(2), transformRequest: Array(1), transformResponse: Array(1), timeout: 0, …} data : message : "Event validation failed: title: Path `title` is required., startDate: Path `startDate` is required., endDate: Path `endDate` is required." [[Prototype]] : Object headers : AxiosHeaders {content-length: '151', content-type: 'application/json; charset=utf-8'} request : XMLHttpRequest {onreadystatechange: null, readyState: 4, timeout: 0, withCredentials: false, upload: XMLHttpRequestUpload, …} status : 400 statusText : "Bad Request" [[Prototype]] : Object stack : "AxiosError: Request failed with status code 400\n at settle (http://localhost:3000/static/js/bundle.js:335879:12)\n at XMLHttpRequest.onloadend (http://localhost:3000/static/js/bundle.js:334541:66)\n at Axios.request (http://localhost:3000/static/js/bundle.js:335042:41)\n at async ScheduleComponent.onSaveClick (http://localhost:3000/main.3d3ac6c3b050a3aaf41b.hot-update.js:629:24)" [[Prototype]] : Error ﻿
ChatGPT

The error message indicates that the server responded with a status code 400 (Bad Request), and the request failed due to validation errors. The server is expecting certain fields (title, startDate, endDate) in the request payload, and it seems that these fields are not being sent or are empty.

To resolve this issue, ensure that you are sending the required fields (title, startDate, endDate) along with the event data when making the POST request to save the new event.

Here's how you can verify and ensure that the required fields are included in the event data before sending the POST request:

javascript
const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
    try {
        // Get the custom field value from the event editor
        const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value;
        
        // Check if eventType is undefined, and if so, set it to an empty string
        const eventTypeValue = eventType || '';

        // Construct the event data with the custom field value
        const eventData = {
            title: args.data.Subject,
            startDate: args.data.StartTime,
            endDate: args.data.EndTime,
            description: args.data.Description,
            eventType: eventTypeValue // Add the custom field value to the event data
        };

        // Check if the required fields are empty or undefined
        if (!eventData.title || !eventData.startDate || !eventData.endDate) {
            console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing');
            return; // Exit the function if required fields are missing
        }

        // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
        const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventData);
        console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error saving event:', error);
    }
};

By checking if the required fields (title, startDate, endDate) are empty or undefined before sending the POST request, you can prevent the validation errors on the server side. If any of the required fields are missing, the function will log an error message and exit without sending the request.

ChatGPT

It seems that some of the required fields (title, startDate, endDate) are missing from the event data. Let's debug and ensure that these fields are correctly populated before sending the POST request.

We can add some console.log statements to check the values of these fields:

javascript
const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
    try {
        // Get the custom field value from the event editor
        const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value;
        
        // Check if eventType is undefined, and if so, set it to an empty string
        const eventTypeValue = eventType || '';

        // Construct the event data with the custom field value
        const eventData = {
            title: args.data.Subject,
            startDate: args.data.StartTime,
            endDate: args.data.EndTime,
            description: args.data.Description,
            eventType: eventTypeValue // Add the custom field value to the event data
        };

        console.log('Event data:', eventData); // Log the event data to check if required fields are present

        // Check if the required fields are empty or undefined
        if (!eventData.title || !eventData.startDate || !eventData.endDate) {
            console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing');
            return; // Exit the function if required fields are missing
        }

        // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
        const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventData);
        console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error saving event:', error);
    }
};

By logging the eventData object before sending the POST request, we can verify if the required fields are present and correctly populated. If any of the required fields are missing, the console.log statement will help identify which fields need to be fixed.

You
vent data: {title: undefined, startDate: undefined, endDate: undefined, description: undefined, eventType: ''}description: undefinedendDate: undefinedeventType: ""startDate: undefinedtitle: undefined[[Prototype]]: Object Calendar.jsx:597 Error saving event: Required fields are missing onSaveClick @ Calendar.jsx:597 Observer.notify @ observer.js:89 ComponentBase.trigger @ component-base.js:252 Crud.refreshData @ crud.js:124 (anonymous) @ crud.js:189 Observer.notify @ observer.js:75 ComponentBase.trigger @ component-base.js:252 Crud.addEvent @ crud.js:167 (anonymous) @ quick-popups.js:1269 Observer.notify @ observer.js:75 ComponentBase.trigger @ component-base.js:252 QuickPopups.quickPopupHide @ quick-popups.js:1264 QuickPopups.saveClick @ quick-popups.js:866 KeyboardInteraction.processEnter @ keyboard.js:241 KeyboardInteraction.keyActionHandler @ keyboard.js:88 KeyboardEvents._this.keyPressHandler @ keyboard.js:103 Show 15 more frames Show less
ChatGPT

The log indicates that the eventData object has undefined values for all the properties, including title, startDate, endDate, and description. This means that the event data is not being properly retrieved from the schedule component.

Let's review the code to identify the issue:

  1. Ensure that the args.data object contains the event data.
  2. Check if the properties Subject, StartTime, EndTime, and Description exist within the args.data object.

Here's a modified version of the onSaveClick function to ensure that the event data is correctly retrieved:

javascript
const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
    try {
        // Check if args.data contains the event data
        if (!args.data) {
            console.error('Error saving event: Event data is missing');
            return;
        }

        // Extract the event data properties
        const { Subject, StartTime, EndTime, Description } = args.data;

        // Check if any of the required properties are missing
        if (!Subject || !StartTime || !EndTime) {
            console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing');
            return;
        }

        // Get the custom field value from the event editor
        const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value;

        // Construct the event data with the custom field value
        const eventData = {
            title: Subject,
            startDate: StartTime,
            endDate: EndTime,
            description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined
            eventType: eventType || '' // Set eventType to an empty string if it's undefined
        };

        console.log('Event data:', eventData);

        // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
        const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventData);
        console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
    } catch (error) {
        console.error('Error saving event:', error);
    }
};

This code ensures that the required event properties are present and correctly populated before attempting to save the event to the database.

You
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, PopupOpenEventArgs } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import axios from 'axios'; drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle); } } }; const onSaveClick = async (args) => { try { // Check if args.data contains the event data if (!args.data) { console.error('Error saving event: Event data is missing'); return; } // Extract the event data properties const { Subject, StartTime, EndTime, Description } = args.data; // Check if any of the required properties are missing if (!Subject || !StartTime || !EndTime) { console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing'); return; } // Get the custom field value from the event editor const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value; // Construct the event data with the custom field value const eventData = { title: Subject, startDate: StartTime, endDate: EndTime, description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined eventType: eventType || '' // Set eventType to an empty string if it's undefined }; } catch (error) { console.error('Error saving event:', error); } }; return ( <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={onPopupOpen} actionComplete={onSaveClick}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent> ); ChatGPT

It seems that the event data passed to the onSaveClick function is missing some required fields. Let's debug and ensure that the event data contains the necessary properties.

You can modify the onSaveClick function to log the event data before sending the POST request to the server. This will help us identify if any required fields are missing or if the event data is not being properly retrieved.

Here's the modified onSaveClick function:

javascript
const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
  try {
    // Check if args.data contains the event data
    if (!args.data) {
      console.error('Error saving event: Event data is missing');
      return;
    }

    // Log the event data
    console.log('Event data:', args.data);

    // Extract the event data properties
    const { Subject, StartTime, EndTime, Description } = args.data;

    // Check if any of the required properties are missing
    if (!Subject || !StartTime || !EndTime) {
      console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing');
      return;
    }

    // Get the custom field value from the event editor
    const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value;

    // Construct the event data with the custom field value
    const eventData = {
      title: Subject,
      startDate: StartTime,
      endDate: EndTime,
      description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined
      eventType: eventType || '' // Set eventType to an empty string if it's undefined
    };

    // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
    const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventData);
    console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error saving event:', error);
  }
};

By logging the event data, we can ensure that all required fields are present and properly populated. This will help us identify the cause of the "Required fields are missing" error. Once we have the correct event data, we can proceed with saving the event to the database.

You
Event data: [{…}]0: {EventType: null, Subject: 'aisha', Location: undefined, StartTime: Thu Mar 14 2024 01:30:00 GMT+0530 (India Standard Time), EndTime: Thu Mar 14 2024 02:00:00 GMT+0530 (India Standard Time), …}length: 1[[Prototype]]: Array(0)at: ƒ at()concat: ƒ concat()constructor: ƒ Array()copyWithin: ƒ copyWithin()entries: ƒ entries()every: ƒ every()fill: ƒ fill()filter: ƒ filter()find: ƒ find()findIndex: ƒ findIndex()findLast: ƒ findLast()findLastIndex: ƒ findLastIndex()flat: ƒ flat()flatMap: ƒ flatMap()forEach: ƒ forEach()includes: ƒ includes()indexOf: ƒ indexOf()join: ƒ join()keys: ƒ keys()lastIndexOf: ƒ lastIndexOf()length: 0map: ƒ map()pop: ƒ pop()push: ƒ push()reduce: ƒ reduce()reduceRight: ƒ reduceRight()reverse: ƒ reverse()shift: ƒ shift()slice: ƒ slice()some: ƒ some()sort: ƒ sort()splice: ƒ splice()toLocaleString: ƒ toLocaleString()toReversed: ƒ toReversed()toSorted: ƒ toSorted()toSpliced: ƒ toSpliced()toString: ƒ toString()unshift: ƒ unshift()values: ƒ values()with: ƒ with()Symbol(Symbol.iterator): ƒ values()Symbol(Symbol.unscopables): {at: true, copyWithin: true, entries: true, fill: true, find: true, …}[[Prototype]]: Object Calendar.jsx:592 Error saving event: Required fields are missing
ChatGPT

It seems that the event data is wrapped in an array. This could be the reason why the required fields are reported as missing.

To resolve this issue, you need to access the event data directly instead of treating it as an array. Since the event data is an array with only one item, you can access it using index 0.

Here's the modified onSaveClick function:

javascript
const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
  try {
    // Check if args.data contains the event data
    if (!args.data || !args.data[0]) {
      console.error('Error saving event: Event data is missing');
      return;
    }

    // Extract the event data properties
    const eventData = args.data[0];
    const { Subject, StartTime, EndTime, Description } = eventData;

    // Check if any of the required properties are missing
    if (!Subject || !StartTime || !EndTime) {
      console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing');
      return;
    }

    // Get the custom field value from the event editor
    const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value;

    // Construct the event data with the custom field value
    const eventDataToSend = {
      title: Subject,
      startDate: StartTime,
      endDate: EndTime,
      description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined
      eventType: eventType || '' // Set eventType to an empty string if it's undefined
    };

    // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
    const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventDataToSend);
    console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error saving event:', error);
  }
};

This modification ensures that the event data is properly accessed and that required fields are correctly checked for their presence.

You
const onPopupOpen = (args) => { if (args.type === 'Editor') { if (!args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-row')) { let row = document.createElement('div'); row.className = 'custom-field-row'; let formElement = args.element.querySelector('.e-schedule-form'); formElement.firstChild.insertBefore(row, formElement.firstChild.firstChild); let container = document.createElement('div'); container.className = 'custom-field-container'; let inputEle = document.createElement('input'); inputEle.className = 'e-field'; inputEle.setAttribute('name', 'EventType'); container.appendChild(inputEle); row.appendChild(container); let drowDownList = new DropDownList({ dataSource: [ { text: 'Public Event', value: 'public-event' }, { text: 'Maintenance', value: 'maintenance' }, { text: 'Commercial Event', value: 'commercial-event' }, { text: 'Family Event', value: 'family-event' } ], fields: { text: 'text', value: 'value' }, floatLabelType: 'Always', placeholder: 'Event Type' }); drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle); } } };/in this popup i dont want event type and location fields
ChatGPT

If you want to remove the "Event Type" and "Location" fields from the popup editor, you can modify the onPopupOpen function accordingly. Here's how you can do it:

javascript
const onPopupOpen = (args) => {
    if (args.type === 'Editor') {
        // Remove the 'Event Type' and 'Location' fields
        const eventTypeField = args.element.querySelector('[name="EventType"]');
        const locationField = args.element.querySelector('[name="Location"]');
        if (eventTypeField) eventTypeField.closest('.e-form-row').style.display = 'none';
        if (locationField) locationField.closest('.e-form-row').style.display = 'none';
    }
};

This code checks if the popup type is "Editor" and then hides the "Event Type" and "Location" fields by setting their respective form rows' display style to "none". This will effectively hide these fields from the popup editor.

You
Cannot read properties of null (reading 'style')
ChatGPT

The error indicates that the querySelector didn't find the elements with the specified names, which caused it to return null. To prevent the error, you should first check if the elements are found before attempting to access their properties. Here's the modified code:

javascript
const onPopupOpen = (args) => {
    if (args.type === 'Editor') {
        // Remove the 'Event Type' and 'Location' fields if they exist
        const eventTypeField = args.element.querySelector('[name="EventType"]');
        const locationField = args.element.querySelector('[name="Location"]');
        if (eventTypeField) {
            const eventTypeRow = eventTypeField.closest('.e-form-row');
            if (eventTypeRow) eventTypeRow.style.display = 'none';
        }
        if (locationField) {
            const locationRow = locationField.closest('.e-form-row');
            if (locationRow) locationRow.style.display = 'none';
        }
    }
};

This code first checks if the elements were found (eventTypeField and locationField). If they exist, it then attempts to find their respective parent rows (eventTypeRow and locationRow). Finally, it sets the display style property of these rows to 'none' if they were found. This ensures that you won't encounter errors when trying to access properties of null elements.

<link href="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-base/styles/material.css" rel="stylesheet" /> <link href="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-buttons/styles/material.css" rel="stylesheet" /> <link href="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-calendars/styles/material.css" rel="stylesheet" /> <link href="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-dropdowns/styles/material.css" rel="stylesheet" /> <link href="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-inputs/styles/material.css" rel="stylesheet" /> <link href="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-navigations/styles/material.css" rel="stylesheet" /> <link href="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-popups/styles/material.css" rel="stylesheet" /> <link href="https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-schedule/styles/material.css" rel="stylesheet" /> <link href="https://maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.7/css/bootstrap.min.css" rel="stylesheet" /> <link href="index.css" rel="stylesheet" /> <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/systemjs/0.19.38/system.js"></script> <script src="systemjs.config.js"></script>i wanna apply these only on one soecific page but its getting applied everywhere how can i apply to only one page in react js
2 / 3
ChatGPT

To apply these styles only to a specific page in your React application, you can utilize CSS Modules or Scoped CSS. Here's how you can achieve this:

  1. CSS Modules: If you're using Create React App or a similar setup that supports CSS Modules, you can create a separate CSS file for the specific page and import only the required styles into that file. This way, the styles will only affect components rendered on that page.
javascript
// SpecificPage.module.css
@import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-base/styles/material.css');
@import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-buttons/styles/material.css');
/* Import other required styles */

/* Your custom styles for the specific page */

javascript
// SpecificPage.js
import React from 'react';
import styles from './SpecificPage.module.css';

const SpecificPage = () => {
    return (
        <div className={styles.container}>
            {/* Page content */}
        </div>
    );
};

export default SpecificPage;
  1. Scoped CSS: If you're not using CSS Modules, you can use scoped CSS techniques provided by libraries like Styled Components or Emotion. These libraries allow you to encapsulate styles to specific components, preventing them from affecting other parts of your application.

Here's an example using Styled Components:

javascript
// SpecificPage.js
import React from 'react';
import styled from 'styled-components';

const PageContainer = styled.div`
    @import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-base/styles/material.css');
    @import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-buttons/styles/material.css');
    /* Import other required styles */

    /* Your custom styles for the specific page */
`;

const SpecificPage = () => {
    return (
        <PageContainer>
            {/* Page content */}
        </PageContainer>
    );
};

export default SpecificPage;

Using either of these methods, you can ensure that the styles are applied only to the specific page you intend.

You
@import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-base/styles/material.css'); @import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-buttons/styles/material.css'); @import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-calendars/styles/material.css" rel="stylesheet'); @import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-dropdowns/styles/material.css'); @import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-inputs/styles/material.css'); @import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-navigations/styles/material.css'); @import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-popups/styles/material.css'); @import url('https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-schedule/styles/material.css'); @import url('https://maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.7/css/bootstrap.min.css'); @import url('index.css'); @import url('https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/systemjs/0.19.38/system.js'); @import url('systemjs.config.js');getting errors
ChatGPT

It seems like you are trying to use CSS @import rules directly within your JavaScript or JSX file. However, this approach is not supported in React.

Instead, you should import CSS files directly into your JavaScript or JSX files using the import statement. Here's how you can do it:

javascript
import React from 'react';
import 'bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css'; // Import Bootstrap CSS
import './index.css'; // Import your custom CSS
import '@syncfusion/ej2-base/styles/material.css'; // Import Syncfusion base styles
import '@syncfusion/ej2-react-buttons/styles/material.css'; // Import Syncfusion button styles
// Import other Syncfusion styles as needed

const App = () => {
    return (
        <div>
            {/* Your React app content */}
        </div>
    );
};

export default App;

In this example, I've used the import statement to import CSS files directly into a React component. Make sure you have installed Bootstrap and other required packages via npm or yarn before importing them like this. Also, adjust the paths to your CSS files as needed.

You
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, PopupOpenEventArgs } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import axios from 'axios'; import { DropDownList } from '@syncfusion/ej2-dropdowns'; import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; import Nav from '../Nav'; import './Calendar.css' import url('index.css'); import url('https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/systemjs/0.19.38/system.js'); import url('systemjs.config.js'); import Header from '../../components/common/header/header'; registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA=='); const CalendarM = () => { const [events, setEvents] = useState([]); drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle); } } }; const onSaveClick = async (args) => { try { // Check if args.data contains the event data if (!args.data || !args.data[0]) { console.error('Error saving event: Event data is missing'); return; } // Extract the event data properties const eventData = args.data[0]; const { Subject, StartTime, EndTime, Description } = eventData; // Check if any of the required properties are missing if (!Subject || !StartTime || !EndTime) { console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing'); return; } // Get the custom field value from the event editor const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value; // Construct the event data with the custom field value const eventDataToSend = { title: Subject, startDate: StartTime, endDate: EndTime, description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined eventType: eventType || '' // Set eventType to an empty string if it's undefined }; // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventDataToSend); console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error saving event:', error); } }; return ( <> <Nav/> <Header/> <ScheduleComponent style={{marginTop:"60px",marginLeft:"80px"}} eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={onPopupOpen} actionComplete={onSaveClick}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent> </> ); }; export default CalendarM;
ChatGPT

In your code, you are attempting to import CSS files using url() statements within a JavaScript or JSX file. This is not the correct syntax for importing CSS files in React.

Instead, you should use the import statement to import CSS files directly into your JavaScript or JSX files. Here's how you can do it:

javascript
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, PopupOpenEventArgs } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';
import axios from 'axios';
import { DropDownList } from '@syncfusion/ej2-dropdowns';
import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base';
import Nav from '../Nav';
import Header from '../../components/common/header/header';
import '@syncfusion/ej2-base/styles/material.css';
import '@syncfusion/ej2-react-buttons/styles/material.css';
import '@syncfusion/ej2-react-calendars/styles/material.css';
import '@syncfusion/ej2-react-dropdowns/styles/material.css';
import '@syncfusion/ej2-react-inputs/styles/material.css';
import '@syncfusion/ej2-react-navigations/styles/material.css';
import '@syncfusion/ej2-react-popups/styles/material.css';
import '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule/styles/material.css';
import 'bootstrap/dist/css/bootstrap.min.css';
import './Calendar.css'; // Import your custom CSS

registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA==');

const CalendarM = () => {
  const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchEvents();
  }, []);

  const fetchEvents = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar');
      setEvents(response.data.map(event => ({
        Id: event._id,
        Subject: event.title,
        StartTime: new Date(event.startDate),
        EndTime: new Date(event.endDate),
        Description: event.description
      })));
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
    }
  };

  const onPopupOpen = (args) => {
    if (args.type === 'Editor') {
      if (!args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-row')) {
        let row = document.createElement('div');
        row.className = 'custom-field-row';
        let formElement = args.element.querySelector('.e-schedule-form');
        formElement.firstChild.insertBefore(row, formElement.firstChild.firstChild);
        let container = document.createElement('div');
        container.className = 'custom-field-container';
        let inputEle = document.createElement('input');
        inputEle.className = 'e-field';
        inputEle.setAttribute('name', 'EventType');
        container.appendChild(inputEle);
        row.appendChild(container);
        let drowDownList = new DropDownList({
          dataSource: [
            { text: 'Public Event', value: 'public-event' },
            { text: 'Maintenance', value: 'maintenance' },
            { text: 'Commercial Event', value: 'commercial-event' },
            { text: 'Family Event', value: 'family-event' }
          ],
          fields: { text: 'text', value: 'value' },
          floatLabelType: 'Always', placeholder: 'Event Type'
        });
        drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle);
      }
    }
  };

  const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
    try {
      // Check if args.data contains the event data
      if (!args.data || !args.data[0]) {
        console.error('Error saving event: Event data is missing');
        return;
      }

      // Extract the event data properties
      const eventData = args.data[0];
      const { Subject, StartTime, EndTime, Description } = eventData;

      // Check if any of the required properties are missing
      if (!Subject || !StartTime || !EndTime) {
        console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing');
        return;
      }

      // Get the custom field value from the event editor
      const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value;

      // Construct the event data with the custom field value
      const eventDataToSend = {
        title: Subject,
        startDate: StartTime,
        endDate: EndTime,
        description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined
        eventType: eventType || '' // Set eventType to an empty string if it's undefined
      };

      // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
      const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventDataToSend);
      console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error saving event:', error);
    }
  };

  return (
    <>
      <Nav />
      <Header />
      <ScheduleComponent style={{ marginTop: "60px", marginLeft: "80px" }}
        eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={onPopupOpen} actionComplete={onSaveClick}>
        <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
      </ScheduleComponent>
    </>
  );
};

export default CalendarM;

In this updated code, I've replaced the url() statements with import statements for importing CSS files. Make sure you have installed Bootstrap and other required packages via npm or yarn before importing them like this. Also, adjust the paths to your CSS files as needed.

You
d to fetch dynamically imported module: https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-base/styles/material.css TypeError: Failed to fetch dynamically imported module: https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-base/styles/material.css
ChatGPT

The error you're encountering indicates that the dynamically imported module at the specified URL (https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-base/styles/material.css) could not be fetched. This could be due to various reasons, such as network issues, server problems, or incorrect URL.

Here are a few steps you can take to troubleshoot and resolve the issue:

  1. Check Network Connection: Ensure that your internet connection is stable and there are no network issues preventing your application from fetching the CSS file.

  2. Verify URL: Double-check the URL of the CSS file to ensure that it is correct and accessible. Sometimes, typos or incorrect paths can lead to fetch failures.

  3. Server Status: Verify if the server hosting the CSS file (cdn.syncfusion.com) is up and running. You can check the server status or try accessing other resources from the same server to confirm.

  4. Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS): Ensure that the server hosting the CSS file allows cross-origin requests from your domain. If CORS is not properly configured, the browser may block the request, resulting in fetch failures.

  5. Fallback Mechanism: Consider using a fallback mechanism to handle cases where the CSS file cannot be fetched. You can provide a local fallback CSS file or handle the error gracefully within your application.

  6. Syncfusion CDN: If the issue persists, you may want to check Syncfusion's documentation or support resources to see if there are any known issues with their CDN or if there are alternative ways to access the required CSS files.

By following these steps and investigating the possible causes, you should be able to identify and resolve the issue with fetching the dynamically imported CSS module.

You
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react'; import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, PopupOpenEventArgs } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule'; import axios from 'axios'; import { DropDownList } from '@syncfusion/ej2-dropdowns'; import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base'; import Nav from '../Nav'; import 'https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-base/styles/material.css' import 'https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-buttons/styles/material.css' import 'https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-calendars/styles/material.css" rel="stylesheet' import 'https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-dropdowns/styles/material.css' import 'https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-inputs/styles/material.css' import 'https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-navigations/styles/material.css' import 'https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-popups/styles/material.css' import 'https://cdn.syncfusion.com/ej2/24.2.3/ej2-react-schedule/styles/material.css' import 'https://maxcdn.bootstrapcdn.com/bootstrap/3.3.7/css/bootstrap.min.css' import './Calendar.css' import Header from '../../components/common/header/header'; registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA=='); const CalendarM = () => { const [events, setEvents] = useState([]); useEffect(() => { fetchEvents(); }, []); const fetchEvents = async () => { try { const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar'); setEvents(response.data.map(event => ({ Id: event._id, Subject: event.title, StartTime: new Date(event.startDate), EndTime: new Date(event.endDate), Description: event.description }))); } catch (error) { console.error('Error fetching events:', error); } }; const onPopupOpen = (args) => { if (args.type === 'Editor') { if (!args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-row')) { let row = document.createElement('div'); row.className = 'custom-field-row'; let formElement = args.element.querySelector('.e-schedule-form'); formElement.firstChild.insertBefore(row, formElement.firstChild.firstChild); let container = document.createElement('div'); container.className = 'custom-field-container'; let inputEle = document.createElement('input'); inputEle.className = 'e-field'; inputEle.setAttribute('name', 'EventType'); container.appendChild(inputEle); row.appendChild(container); let drowDownList = new DropDownList({ dataSource: [ { text: 'Public Event', value: 'public-event' }, { text: 'Maintenance', value: 'maintenance' }, { text: 'Commercial Event', value: 'commercial-event' }, { text: 'Family Event', value: 'family-event' } ], fields: { text: 'text', value: 'value' }, floatLabelType: 'Always', placeholder: 'Event Type' }); drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle); } } }; const onSaveClick = async (args) => { try { // Check if args.data contains the event data if (!args.data || !args.data[0]) { console.error('Error saving event: Event data is missing'); return; } // Extract the event data properties const eventData = args.data[0]; const { Subject, StartTime, EndTime, Description } = eventData; // Check if any of the required properties are missing if (!Subject || !StartTime || !EndTime) { console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing'); return; } // Get the custom field value from the event editor const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value; // Construct the event data with the custom field value const eventDataToSend = { title: Subject, startDate: StartTime, endDate: EndTime, description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined eventType: eventType || '' // Set eventType to an empty string if it's undefined }; // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventDataToSend); console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error saving event:', error); } }; return ( <> <Nav/> <Header/> <ScheduleComponent style={{marginTop:"60px",marginLeft:"80px"}} eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={onPopupOpen} actionComplete={onSaveClick}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent> </> );the imported urls i want to apply them only on this page but its getting applied on every page n giving error
ChatGPT

To apply the CSS styles from the imported URLs only to the specific page where your CalendarM component is rendered, you can follow these steps:

  1. Remove the global imports of CSS files from your CalendarM component file.
  2. Import the CSS files locally within the component file.
  3. Ensure that the imported CSS files are scoped to the component's container or class.

Here's how you can modify your CalendarM component:

jsx
import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { ScheduleComponent, Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda, Inject, PopupOpenEventArgs } from '@syncfusion/ej2-react-schedule';
import axios from 'axios';
import { DropDownList } from '@syncfusion/ej2-dropdowns';
import { registerLicense } from '@syncfusion/ej2-base';
import Nav from '../Nav';
import './Calendar.css'; // Import local CSS file for component-specific styles
import Header from '../../components/common/header/header';
registerLicense('Ngo9BigBOggjHTQxAR8/V1NAaF1cXmhNYVppR2Nbe052flVBalhQVAciSV9jS3pTdURjWXled3BXR2lcWA==');

const CalendarM = () => {
  const [events, setEvents] = useState([]);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchEvents();
  }, []);

  const fetchEvents = async () => {
    try {
      const response = await axios.get('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar');
      setEvents(response.data.map(event => ({
        Id: event._id,
        Subject: event.title,
        StartTime: new Date(event.startDate),
        EndTime: new Date(event.endDate),
        Description: event.description
      })));
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error fetching events:', error);
    }
  };

  const onPopupOpen = (args) => {
    if (args.type === 'Editor') {
        if (!args.element.querySelector('.custom-field-row')) {
            let row = document.createElement('div');
            row.className = 'custom-field-row';
            let formElement = args.element.querySelector('.e-schedule-form');
            formElement.firstChild.insertBefore(row, formElement.firstChild.firstChild);
            let container = document.createElement('div');
            container.className = 'custom-field-container';
            let inputEle = document.createElement('input');
            inputEle.className = 'e-field';
            inputEle.setAttribute('name', 'EventType');
            container.appendChild(inputEle);
            row.appendChild(container);
            let drowDownList = new DropDownList({
                dataSource: [
                    { text: 'Public Event', value: 'public-event' },
                    { text: 'Maintenance', value: 'maintenance' },
                    { text: 'Commercial Event', value: 'commercial-event' },
                    { text: 'Family Event', value: 'family-event' }
                ],
                fields: { text: 'text', value: 'value' },
                floatLabelType: 'Always', placeholder: 'Event Type'
            });
            drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle);
        }
    }
};

const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
  try {
    // Check if args.data contains the event data
    if (!args.data || !args.data[0]) {
      console.error('Error saving event: Event data is missing');
      return;
    }

    // Extract the event data properties
    const eventData = args.data[0];
    const { Subject, StartTime, EndTime, Description } = eventData;

    // Check if any of the required properties are missing
    if (!Subject || !StartTime || !EndTime) {
      console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing');
      return;
    }

    // Get the custom field value from the event editor
    const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value;

    // Construct the event data with the custom field value
    const eventDataToSend = {
      title: Subject,
      startDate: StartTime,
      endDate: EndTime,
      description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined
      eventType: eventType || '' // Set eventType to an empty string if it's undefined
    };

    // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
    const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventDataToSend);
    console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error saving event:', error);
  }
};

return (
  <>
  <Nav/>
  <Header/>
    <ScheduleComponent style={{marginTop:"60px",marginLeft:"80px"}}
    eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={onPopupOpen} actionComplete={onSaveClick}>
        <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} />
    </ScheduleComponent>
    </>
);
};

export default CalendarM;

By importing the CSS files locally within the component file and applying them via class names or scoped styles, you ensure that they only affect the specific page where your CalendarM component is rendered. Make sure to remove the global CSS imports from other places in your project to prevent them from affecting other pages.

You
// Construct the event data with the custom field value const eventDataToSend = { title: Subject, startDate: StartTime, endDate: EndTime, description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined eventType: eventType || '' , Location: location || '' };Line 90:17: Unexpected use of 'location' no-restricted-globals
ChatGPT

The error message "Unexpected use of 'location' no-restricted-globals" suggests that you are attempting to use the location global object, which is restricted in certain environments or linters due to potential misuse.

To resolve this issue, you can rename the variable location to something else, such as eventLocation. Here's the modified code:

javascript
// Construct the event data with the custom field value
const eventDataToSend = {
  title: Subject,
  startDate: StartTime,
  endDate: EndTime,
  description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined
  eventType: eventType || '',
  eventLocation: location || '' // Renamed the variable to eventLocation
};

By renaming the variable to eventLocation, you avoid using the restricted global object location, and the error should be resolved.

drowDownList.appendTo(inputEle); } } }; const onSaveClick = async (args) => { try { // Check if args.data contains the event data if (!args.data || !args.data[0]) { console.error('Error saving event: Event data is missing'); return; } // Extract the event data properties const eventData = args.data[0]; const { Subject, StartTime, EndTime, Description } = eventData; // Check if any of the required properties are missing if (!Subject || !StartTime || !EndTime) { console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing'); return; } // Get the custom field value from the event editor const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value; // Construct the event data with the custom field value const eventDataToSend = { title: Subject, startDate: StartTime, endDate: EndTime, description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined EventType: eventType || '' , EventLocation: location || '' }; // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventDataToSend); console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data); } catch (error) { console.error('Error saving event:', error); } }; return ( <> <ScheduleComponent eventSettings={{ dataSource: events }} popupOpen={onPopupOpen} actionComplete={onSaveClick}> <Inject services={[Day, Week, WorkWeek, Month, Agenda]} /> </ScheduleComponent> </> ); }; export default CalendarM; Line 90:17: Unexpected use of 'location' no-restricted-globals
ChatGPT

The error "Unexpected use of 'location' no-restricted-globals" indicates that you are trying to use the global variable location, which is a restricted keyword in some environments. To fix this error, you can rename the variable location to something else, such as eventLocation.

Here's the modified code:

javascript
const onSaveClick = async (args) => {
  try {
    // Check if args.data contains the event data
    if (!args.data || !args.data[0]) {
      console.error('Error saving event: Event data is missing');
      return;
    }

    // Extract the event data properties
    const eventData = args.data[0];
    const { Subject, StartTime, EndTime, Description } = eventData;

    // Check if any of the required properties are missing
    if (!Subject || !StartTime || !EndTime) {
      console.error('Error saving event: Required fields are missing');
      return;
    }

    // Get the custom field value from the event editor
    const eventType = args.element?.querySelector('.custom-field-container input')?.value;

    // Construct the event data with the custom field value
    const eventDataToSend = {
      title: Subject,
      startDate: StartTime,
      endDate: EndTime,
      description: Description || '', // Set description to an empty string if it's undefined
      EventType: eventType || '' ,
      EventLocation: '' // Change 'location' to 'EventLocation'
    };

    // Send a POST request to your server to save the new event data
    const response = await axios.post('http://localhost:5000/api/auth/calendar', eventDataToSend);
    console.log('Event saved successfully:', response.data);
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error saving event:', error);
  }
};

By renaming the variable location to EventLocation, you avoid using the restricted global object location, and the error should be resolved.
